Name: Yusef Salem Yusef Radwan
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while participating in a protest near the separation fence, which included stone and explosive device throwing at the forces.

Name: Muhammad Walid Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while in an apartment in a residential building.

Name: Iyad al-'Abed al-Hasani
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while in an apartment in a residential building.

Name: Hussein Yusef 'Abdallah Dalul
Notes: Killed with another al-Mujahedin Movement military wing operative while trying to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: Muhammad Suliman Khalil Dader
Notes: Killed with another al-Mujahedin Movement military wing operative while trying to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: 'Abd al-Halim Jawdat Kheir a-Najar
Notes: Killed while engaging in military activity together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was wounded and died of his wounds the next day.

Name: 'Alian 'Ata 'Alian Abu Wadi
Notes: Wounded while engaging in military activity together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was killed on the spot.

Name: 'Udai Riyad Ahmad a-Loh
Notes: Killed while trying to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: 'Ali Hassan Muhammad Ghali
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed together with his brother and nephew, both Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, when a missle struck an apartment they were in in the city. Seven other Palestinians were wounded in the missile strike.

Name: Mahmoud Hassan Muhammad Ghali
Notes: Killed together with his brother, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, and nephew, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missle struck an apartment they were in in the city. Seven other Palestinians were wounded in the missile strike.

Name: Mahmoud Walid Mahmoud 'Abd al-Jawad
Notes: Killed together with two of his uncles, one of whom was a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, and the other an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missle struck an apartment they were in in the city. Seven other Palestinians were wounded in the missile strike.

Name: Ahmad Mahmoud Hamdan Abu Daqah
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed by a missile that struck as soon as he entered his home.

Name: 'Alam a-Din Samir Tawfiq 'Abd al-'Aziz
Notes: Killed together with another PFLP military wing operative while trying to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: Ayman Karam Hussein Seidam
Notes: Killed together with another PFLP military wing operative while trying to fire mortar shells at Israel.

Name: Muhammad Yusef Hussni Abu Ta'imah
Notes: Wounded together with another PFLP military wing operative while trying to fire mortar shells at Israel. Both died of their wounds later that day.

Name: 'Alaa Maher Yasin Abu Ta'imah
Notes: Wounded together with another PFLP military wing operative while trying to fire mortar shells at Israel. Both died of their wounds later that day.

Name: Wael Muhammad Sabri al-Agha
Notes: Killed together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while riding in a car in the north west of the town.

Name: Saed Jawad 'Abed Farwaneh
Notes: Killed together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while riding in a car in the north west of the town.

Name: Tareq Ibrahim Muhammad 'Iz a-Din
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed together with his son and daughter, both minors, when a missile struck their home. His neighbors, a couple and their son, were also killed. His wife, son and four other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Jamal Saber Muhammad Khaswan
Notes: Killed together with his wife and son when a missile struck his home and the home of his neighbor, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed together with his son and daughter, both minors. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Yusef Jamal Saber Khaswan
Notes: Killed together with his parents when a missile struck their home and the home of their neighbor, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed together with his son and daughter, both minors. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Mirvat Saleh Muhammad Khaswan
Notes: Killed together with her husband and son when a missile struck her home and the home of her neighbor, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed together with his son and daughter, both minors. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Mayar Tareq Muhammad 'Iz a-Din
Notes: Killed together with her brother, a minor, and her father, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. Their neighbors, a couple and their son, were also killed. His mother and brother and four other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: 'Ali Tareq Ibrahim 'Iz a-Din
Notes: Killed together with his sister, a minor, and his father, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. His neighbors, a couple and their son, were also killed. His mother and brother and four other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Daniyah 'Alaa 'Ata 'Adas
Notes: Killed together with her sister, a minor, in their home, when a missile struck their building. A senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, his wife and his minor daughter were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Iman 'Alaa 'Ata 'Adas
Notes: Killed together with her sister in their home, when a missile struck their building. A senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, his wife and his minor daughter were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Hajar Khalil Salah al-Bahtini
Notes: Killed together with her mother and father, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. Two sisters living in the same building, one of them a minor, were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Layla Majdi Mustafa al-Bahtini
Notes: Killed together with her daughter, a minor, and her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. Two sisters living in the same building, one of them a minor, were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Khalil Salah Khaled al-Bahtini
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed together with his wife and daughter, a minor, when a missile struck their home. Two sisters living in the same building, one of them a minor, were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Jihad Shaker Diab 'Abd al-Hafez Ghanam
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed with his wife when a missile struck their home.

Name: Wafaa Nimer Tawfiq Ghanam
Notes: Killed together with her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home.

Name: Hashel Mubarak Salman Mubarak
Notes: Injured in his home after pieces of concrete and rocks fell on it when a Hamas military wing training site was bombed.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Jum'ah Khalaf a-Silk
Notes: Wounded by a missile while riding in a taxi with his brother, who was also wounded. Died of his wounds shortly after. Two other people riding on a horse-drawn cart were also killed in the attack and two others were wounded, including a Hamas government police traffic officer who died of his wounds the next day.

Name: Shadi 'Imad Nimer Kahil
Notes: Killed by a missile along another man as they were riding in a horse-drawn cart on the street. Another man riding in a taxi that passed nearby was also killed in the attack and three people were wounded, including a Hamas government police traffic officer, who died of his wounds the next day.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Sab' Dawood
Notes: Traffic officer in the Hamas government police. Wounded by a missile while directing traffic. Two people riding on a horse-drawn cart and another man who was riding in a taxi that passed nearby were also killed in the attack. Two more people were wounded in the attack.

Name: Khaled Ayman Jamil Yasin
Notes: Killed by a missile along with another man as they were riding in a horse-drawn cart on the street. Another man riding in a taxi that passed nearby was also killed in the attack and three people were wounded, including a Hamas government police traffic officer, who died of his wounds the next day.

Name: Muhammad Salah Hamed Nijm
Notes: Killed by a missile along with three relatives and a neighbor, all minors, while at the al-Falujah Cemetery near their homes.

Name: Hamed Haydar Hamed Nijm
Notes: Killed by a missile along with three relatives and a neighbor, all minors, while at the al-Falujah Cemetery near their homes.

Name: Jamil Najm a-Din Jamil Nijm
Notes: Killed by a missile along with three relatives and a neighbor, all minors, while at the al-Falujah Cemetery near their homes.

Name: Jamil Ihab Jamil Nijm
Notes: Killed by a missile along with three relatives and a neighbor, all minors, while at the al-Falujah Cemetery near their homes.

Name: Nazmi Fayez 'Abd al-Hadi Abu Karsh
Notes: Killed by a missile along with four neighbors, all minors related to each other, while at the al-Falujah Cemetery near their homes.

Name: Tamim Ghassan 'Abdallah Hijazi
Notes: Killed by a missile along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative when they were in an open area east of Khan Yunis, engaging in military wing activities.

Name: Ousamah 'Abd a-Rahman Hussein a-Suri
Notes: Wounded by a missile along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed by the missile, when they were in an open area east of Khan Yunis, engaging in military wing activities. Died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Nur a-Din Hussein 'Ali a-Zwiedi
Notes: Wounded in the head by missile shrapnel while behind his house along with his brother, who was also wounded. Died of his wounds later that day. The neighbor was also wounded and died of his wounds on 9 August 2022.

Name: Ibrahim Shehdeh Salah Abu Salah
Notes: Wounded by a missile while behind the house of the neighbors, who were also wounded. One of them died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Hassan Muhammad Hussein Mansur
Notes: Killed by a missile in an open area, where he was engaging in Democratic Front military wing activities together with another military wing operative, who was wounded in the attack.

Name: Ziad Ahmad Khalil al-Modalal
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior members of the military wing when guided bombs hit his home. The bombs also killed two residents of the building, the son of one of them and a minor who lives in a building nearby. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Khaled Sa'id Shihadah Mansur
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior members of the military wing when guided bombs hit the home of one of them. The bombs also killed two residents of the building, the son of one of the residents and a minor who lives in the next building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Raafat Sameh Ibrahim a-Zamli
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior members of the military wing when guided bombs hit the home of one of them. The bombs also killed two residents of the building, the son of one of the residents and a minor who lives in a building nearby. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Muhammad Iyad Muhammad Hasunah
Notes: Killed at home when guided bombs hit a nearby building, killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, two residents of the building and the son of one of the residents. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Isma'il 'Abd al-Hamid Muhammad Dweik
Notes: Killed at home along with his mother when guided bombs hit their building, also killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Hanaa Isma'il 'Ali Dweik
Notes: Killed at home along with her son when guided bombs hit their building, also killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Alaa Saleh 'Abd al-Muhsen al-Mallahi
Notes: Killed at home when guided bombs hit her building, killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and her son, and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Nayef Khaled Nayef al-'Odat
Notes: Wounded while on his way to his grandfather s house when a agricultural land in the neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Duniana 'Adnan 'Atiyyah al-'Amur
Notes: Wounded in the head and chest from a tank shell while at home, about one kilometer away from the Gaza perimeter fence. Her mother and sister were wounded in the attack. Died of her wounds shortly after.

Name: Alaa 'Abdallah Riyad Qadum
Notes: Killed by a missile fired at a motorcycle that passed near her as she was walking along the street past Abu Samrah Mosque near her home in a-Shuja iya neighborhood. Two other Palestinians were killed in the incident, a volunteer muazzin who was sitting in the mosque s doorway and her cousin, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was riding the motorcycle with her father, also a senior military wing operative. Three more people were wounded, including her brother, who was a minor.

Name: 'Imad 'Abd a-Rahim Ibrahim Shalah
Notes: Volunteer muazzin. Killed by a missile fired at a motorcycle that passed nearby as he was sitting in the doorway of Abu Samrah Mosque in a-Shuja iya neighborhood. Two other Palestinians were killed in the incident   a five-year-old girl who was passing by on a nearby street and her cousin, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was riding the motorcycle with her father, also a senior military wing operative. Three more people were wounded, including a minor.

Name: Yusef Suliman Muhammad Qadum
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle with his uncle, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, near Abu Samrah Mosque in a-Shuja iya neighborhood. Two other Palestinians were killed in the incident   a volunteer muazzin who was sitting in the mosque s doorway and Qadum s five-year-old cousin, who was walking along the street. Three more people were wounded, including his cousin, who was a minor.

Name: Fadel Mustafa Ajaryu Zo'rub
Notes: Killed by a missile along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative when they were in a military wing training base. A minor who was traveling in a car that passed by the site was wounded in the head in the attack. She died of her wounds on 11 August 2022 at an East Jerusalem hospital after having been in a coma since her injury. Two other military wing operatives and five members of the minor s family, including three minors, were also wounded in the attack.

Name: Muhammad Hassan Musa al-Byuk
Notes: Killed by a missile along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative when they were in a military wing training base. A minor who was traveling in a car that passed by the site was wounded in the head in the attack. She died of her wounds on 11 August 2022 at an East Jerusalem hospital after having been in a coma since her injury. Two other military wing operatives and five members of the minor s family, including three minors, were also wounded in the attack.

Name: Layan Musleh Hamdi a-Sha'er
Notes: Wounded in the head by shrapnel from a missile that hit an Islamic Jihad military wing training base as the car she was traveling in with her family passed nearby. Remained in a coma after the injury and died at an East Jerusalem hospital. Two military wing operatives were killed in the attack and two others were wounded. Five members of a-Sha er s family were also wounded, including three minors.

Name: Ahmad Mazen Mahmoud 'Azzam
Notes: Killed by a tank shell while at an Islamic Jihad military wing observation post.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad 'Abd al-Fatah Nasrallah
Notes: Killed by a tank shell while at an Islamic Jihad military wing observation post. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative and his daughter, a minor, were also wounded in the attack as they were walking away from the post.

Name: Taysir Mahmoud Muhammad al-Ja'bari
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed with another senior member of the military wing when guided bombs hit the apartment they were in. 26 more people were wounded, including 10 minors.

Name: Salamah Muhareb 'Abdallah A'bed
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed with another senior member of the military wing when guided bombs hit the apartment they were in. 26 more people were wounded, including 10 minors.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Abu 'Ammar
Notes: Shot in the neck by soldiers while hunting birds several dozen meters from the perimeter fence.

Name: Ahmad Mustafa Mahmoud Saleh
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers  gunfire during a  Nightly Confusion  protest near the perimeter fence east of Jabalya Refugee Camp, during which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at soldiers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Ousamah Khaled Muhammad D'eij
Notes: Wounded by security forces  gunfire during a demonstration near the perimeter fence in which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at them. A Palestinian teen and a Border Police officer who were shot during the demonstration died of their wounds in the following days.

Name: 'Omar Hassan Musa Abu a-Nil
Notes: Wounded in the neck by security forces  gunfire while standing about 100 meters from the perimeter fence during a demonstration in which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at them. A Palestinian teen and a Border Police officer who were shot during the demonstration died of their wounds in the following days.

Name: Myasarah 'Abd a-Shakur Musbah al-'Ar'ir
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative while traveling in a car in the a-Saftawi neighborhood.

Name: 'Omar Ahmad Muhammad Jundiyah
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative while traveling in a car in the a-Saftawi neighborhood.

Name: Hashem Shaher Muhammad a-Shurafa
Notes: Killed while he was with other operatives from the military wing of an armed Palestinian group.

Name: Huda Salah Rabi' al-Khazandar
Notes: Killed at her home, which was hit in an attack on a neighbors  house. Her husband, son, and 10 other people were injured in the incident.

Name: Raed Zakaria Muhammad Hamad
Notes: Activist in the Popular Front for the Liberation Of Palestine who was burned to death when a shell hit his room and started a fire.

Name: Yasser 'Atiyyah Muhammad al-Masri
Notes: Senior operative in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad. Wounded in the head by shrapnel from a missile that hit the ground near his house while he was inside.

Name: 'Ammar 'Abdallah Fawzi a-Nazer
Notes: Killed while he was with other people in the town.

Name: Dima Sa'ed 'Ali 'Asaliyah
Notes: Killed near her home, while she was on her way to fetch a pot from her older sister's house.

Name: 'Omar Muhammad Amin al-Mankush
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in a house in the a-Rimal neighborhood.

Name: Hassan Muhammad 'Ali Salem
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in a house in the a-Rimal neighborhood.

Name: Yusef Muhammad 'Abd al-Qader Abu Hussein
Notes: A broadcaster on Hamas' al-Aqsa Radio. Killed at home. Another missile was fired at his car, which was parked by the house.

Name: Hassan Sami Hassan al-Burno
Notes: Killed while watering an okra field.

Name: Mahmoud Ramadan 'Omar Shteiwi
Notes: Killed on farmland behind his house in the a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Ousamah Ashraf Muhammad Abu Raidah
Notes: Injured at the entrance to his home when a nearby shack was bombed.

Name: 'Ali Walid al-'Abed Brreis
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Muhammad Hassan Hassan Abu Sem'an
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Ahmad Khalil Hijazi a-Loh
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Muhammad Jamal 'Ali Abu Sem'an
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in a previous attack on the vehicle.

Name: Adib Sa'id Dib a-Surani
Notes: Taxi driver. Killed while driving four Hamas military wing operatives to a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The four operatives were killed in a later attack.

Name: Rafif Murshed Kamel Abu Dayer
Notes: Killed with her uncle in her yard as she was about to have lunch, after the uncle and his family had fled there, in an airstrike on the a-Shawa building on al-Wehda Street opposite the house. The strike destroyed the two top floors of the a-Shawa building, which held NGO offices.

Name: Ziad Kamel 'Abdallah Abu Dayer
Notes: Killed as he was about to have lunch in the yard of his brother's house, where he was sheltering with his wife and son, in an airstrike on the a-Shawa building on al-Wehda Street opposite the house. His niece, a minor, was also killed. The strike destroyed the two top floors of the a-Shawa building, which held NGO offices.

Name: Ahmad Ziad Hussein Sabah
Notes: Killed with a Hamas military wing operative at Hamudah Square in the town.

Name: Muhammad Nazir Muhammad Abu 'On
Notes: Killed with an Islamic Jihad military wing operative at Hamudah Square in the town.

Name: Yusef Rafiq Isma'il al-Baz
Notes: Killed while he was at a car wash next to his home with his father and his brother, a minor, who was injured in the attack.

Name: Husam Muhammad 'Othman Abu Harbid
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a building that had been vacated by the occupants.

Name: Sameh Jihad Msameh al-Qadi
Notes: Killed on farmland with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Tareq Mahmoud Qassem al-Qadi
Notes: Killed on farmland with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Khaled Salem Hassan al-Masalhah
Notes: Killed at home. His wife and son were injured.

Name: Tareq Ziad Mustafa Abu Hmeidan
Notes: Killed while he was with two other Hamas military wing operatives, who were injured in the attack.

Name: Muhammad 'Awni 'Abdallah a-Z'anin
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Muhammad Yusef Mahmoud al-Kafarneh
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Mu'az Nabil Muhammad a-Z'anin
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Fawaz Amin Muhammad al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with his parents, sister, wife, his three children, his daughter-in-law and four-month-old grandson, his sister-in-law and three of her children, three of them minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Amin Muhammad Hamad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his wife, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife, and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Sa'diyah Yusef Taher al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Bahaa Amin Muhammad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her parents, brother, two sisters-in-law, six of her nephews, two of them minors, her nephew's wife and the four-month-old son of one of the nephews, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: 'Abir Nimer 'Ali Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her four children, between the ages of two and nine, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including six minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Tawfiq Ayman Tawfiq Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his parents, sister, grandparents, four other people from his extended family, and 12 other occupants, including nine minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Tawfiq Isma'il Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his wife, their son, their daughter-in-law and two of their grandchildren, both minors, as well as four people from their extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Lana Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, two brothers and sister, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including five minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Ayman Tawfiq Isma'il Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his wife and their two children, both minors, his parents, four other people from his extended family, and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Dana Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, two brothers and two sisters, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including three minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Du'aa 'Omar 'Abdallah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, two of their children, both of them minors, her brother-in-law and three of their children, all minors, and 14 other people from her husband's extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Amal Jamil Salamah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with three of her children, two of them minors, her in-laws, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Rula Muhammad Mu'in al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her father and two sisters, both of them minors, her uncle, his wife and their two children, both minors, as well as 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Taher Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his brother and sister, both of them minors, his mother, two of his uncles, his grandparents, and 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Ahmad Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his sister, who was a minor, his brother, his mother, two of his uncles and his grandparents, as well as 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Hanaa Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her mother and two brothers, one of them a minor, two of her uncles, her grandparents, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Esbitah Khalaf 'Azzam
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative on a-Dahdhuh Street.

Name: Muhammad Khaled 'Omar a-Tawashi
Notes: Killed on farmland behind his family's home.

Name: Hur Muamen Jamal a-Zamli
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

Name: Khulud Fouad Farhan a-Zamli
Notes: Killed at home with her infant daughter, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Walaa Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed in her parents' home with her father and two of her sisters while six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Warda Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Muhammad Aman
Notes: Killed at home with three of his daughters, one of whom was six months pregnant. His wife, his two sons and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Ahmad Kamel 'Abd al-Karim 'Ammar
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle in the eastern part of the town. Succumbed to his wounds in hospital in Egypt.

Name: Muhammad Mu'in Muhammad al-Qar'ah
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Mun'im Ibrahim Shahin
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Hamzah Mahmoud Ibrahim al-Hur
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Ahmad Walid Hussein a-Tala'a
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Bashar Ahmad Ibrahim Samur
Notes: Fatally shot while working in a field by the perimeter fence east of Khan Yunis, along with two relatives.

Name: Mayami 'Abdallah Musa 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her daughter. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Khaled Mahmoud 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her mother. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Majed 'Abd Rabo Mahmoud Abu Sa'adah
Notes: Killed while talking on the street by his home with a cooking gas vendor who was sitting in a car.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Muhammad Abu 'Amer
Notes: Cooking gas vendor. Killed while sitting in his car and talking with a resident who was on the street.

Name: Nael Khaled Yunes al-Barawi
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: 'Atef 'Abd a-Rahman Jum'ah al-Barawi
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: Tal'at Jamil Mahmoud Warsh Agha
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: Wael Mahmoud Fares al-Ghulah
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: 'Abd a-Salam Mahmoud Nabih al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on the street by his cousin s sewing workshop, when a missile hit a nearby car. Another Palestinian who was on the street by his house and three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife, were also killed in the strike. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Mansur Yusef Hassan a-Darimli
Notes: Killed on the street by his house, when a missile hit a nearby car. Two cousins who were on the street by a tailor shop belonging to one of them were also killed, along with three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Maysoun Zaki Hashem al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with her husband and a taxi driver who was driving the couple and their son to their daughters' house. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of her children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: Nader Muhammad Nabih al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on the street by his sewing workshop, when a missile hit a nearby car. Another Palestinian who was on the street by his house and three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife, were also killed in the strike. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Sa'id Hashem Sa'id al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with Sa'id and Maysoun al-Hittu while driving the couple and their son to their daughter's house in the a-Sabra neighborhood in his taxi. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of the his children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: Mustafa Mazen Salem Kurdiyah
Notes: Killed along with Sa'id and Maysoun al-Hittu while driving the couple and their son to their daughter's house in the a-Sabra neighborhood in his taxi. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of the couple's children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: 'Ammar Taysir Muhammad al-'Amur
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on their way home from a barbershop, after stopping by his uncle's grocery store to buy food. His 11-year-old brother was injured in the attack.

Name: Hamadah 'Atiyyah A'bed al-'Amur
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on their way home from a barbershop, after stopping by his father's grocery store to buy food. The cousin's 11-year-old brother was injured in the attack.

Name: Maryam Muhammad 'Odeh a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with her mother and her brother, a minor, in an airstrike on their building. Her father was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Hala Hussein Raafat a-Rifi
Notes: Killed at home in an airstrike on a nearby building in which three members of the a-Talbani family, including two minors, and two senior Hamas military wing operatives were killed.

Name: Hassan Muhammad Hassan al-Qahwaji
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with another senior military wing operative in a building in which three members of the a-Talbani family were also killed, including two minors. Another minor in a nearby building was killed in the attack.

Name: Wael 'Abd al-Karim 'Ali 'Issa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with another senior military wing operative in a building in which three members of the a-Talbani family were also killed, including two minors. Another minor in a nearby building was killed in the attack.

Name: Rima Sa'ed Kamel a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with her son and daughter, both minors, in an airstrike on their building. Her husband was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her daughter's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Zeid Muhammad 'Odeh a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with his mother and his sister, a minor, in an airstrike on their building. His father was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. His sister's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Jum'ah 'Abdallah Muhammad a-Tahlah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Bassem Subhi Sha'ban 'Issa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Hazem Musbeh Ibrahim al-Khatib
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Walid Musa Khaled Shmali
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Jamal Muhammad Sa'id a-Zebdah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Zafer Mazen Zafer a-Shawa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Akram Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal al-'Attar
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Jamil Fares
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Sami Sa'id Muhammad Radwan
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mujahed Majed Yusef al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Ousamah Jamal Sa'id a-Zebdah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Nidal Habib Isma'il Hana
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: 'Awad Nabil Muhammad Abu Selmiyeh
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mustafa Muhammad Suliman Farhat
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Sa'id Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim Ahmad Abu Sakran
Notes: Killed at the doorway to his home along with his nephew, who was visiting, by a missile that landed there. His son and three other people, one of them a minor, were injured.

Name: Muhammad Nahed Jaber Abu Sakran
Notes: Killed along with his uncle at the doorway to the latter's home, by a missile that landed there. Four other people were injured.

Name: 'Iz a-Din Muhammad 'Abdallah Hiles
Notes: Killed while driving in his car with his brother, who was injured in the attack.

Name: Muhammad Jamil Ahmad Kalusah
Notes: Killed on a street in the city center when a military base and a public park in the al-Mahatah neighborhood were bombed.

Name: Munzer 'Abd al-Karim Muhammad Barakah
Notes: Killed along with his brother when the two came with their father to tend to their chicks, in a coop that lies on leased land.

Name: Manar 'Abd al-Karim Muhammad Barakah
Notes: Killed along with his brother when the two came with their father to tend to their chicks, in a coop that lies on leased land.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Yusef 'Ali Subuh
Notes: Had cerebral palsy. Killed along with his mother when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

Name: Amirah 'Abd al-Fatah 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
Notes: Killed along with her son, who had cerebral palsy, when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Ra'uf Muhammad Hiles
Notes: Injured at the entrance to his shop. Another store owner, his son and another Palestinian out on the street were injured in the attack. He succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Muhammad Yihya Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Kamal Taysir Salman Qreiqi'
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Sameh Fahim Hashem al-Mamluk
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Minnah Iyad Fathi Sharir
Notes: Injured in an attack on her family's two-story building, which collapsed. Her mother, her 15-year-old sister and her father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, were killed in the strike.

Name: Lina Iyad Fathi Sharir
Notes: Killed along with her mother and her father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler sister was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Iyad Fathi Fayeq Sharir
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with his wife and their 15-year-old daughter in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. His toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Layali Taha A'bbas Sharir
Notes: Killed along with her 15-year-old daughter and her husband, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Nazem Khaled a-Najar
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Rashid Khamis a-Najar
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Wael Mahmoud Ibrahim Sleih
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Amjad Fouad Ahmad Kaware'
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Tareq Musa 'Abdallah Abu Mustafa
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Yunes Ibrahim Abu Hijazi
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Fahed Jamal Hussein al-Farra
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: 'Abdallah Ahmad Ibrahim Abu Khater
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muamen 'Omar Suliman Abu a-Naja
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Saber Ibrahim Mahmoud Suliman
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed by a missile along with his son, a minor, while the two were on farmland.

Name: Muhammad Saber Ibrahim Suliman
Notes: Killed by a missile along with his father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, while the two were on farmland.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad 'Abed Abu 'Amshah
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a Hamas military wing outpost. His body was extracted about two days later.

Name: Salim Muhammad Salim al-Farra
Notes: Injured by a missile while on the street in the al-Manarah neighborhood with other Humat al-Aqsa military wing operatives.

Name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Fayad
Notes: Killed on farmland in the al-Bura area east of Beit Hanoun.

Name: Muayad Ahmad Muhammad Hamdan
Notes: Killed while walking along the street, by an airstrike on the home of the Hamad family in the town.

Name: Taha Mahmoud Taher al-'Aqad
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Munib Majed Ibrahim Abu Mustafa
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Mahmoud Kamal Ibrahim Kulab
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Munib Mahmoud Ahmad Hamdan
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Malek Isma'il Ahmad Hamdan
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Sabri Hussein Abu 'Obeidah
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Mus'ab Muhammad Jamil Abu Hajaj
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: 'Abd a-Salam Sa'ed Isma'il al-'Ajili
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including another senior operative, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Musa Saleh a-Zinati
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including another senior operative, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021

Name: Muhammad 'Ali Hassan a-Na'em
Notes: Killed by live fire and a missile after, the military alleges, he and another operative with the Islamic Jihad military wing tried to plant an explosive device near the Gaza Perimeter Fence, soldiers fired at them, they fled, and the soldiers fired at them again. When Palestinians tried to remove the body, about 100 meters from the fence, soldiers opened fire at them and injured two, and a military bulldozer pursued them, injuring the body and lifting it in the air. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abdallah Ahmad Naser Abu Naser
Notes: Killed by a missile near the Gaza perimeter fence while armed. After he was hit, the army prevented Palestinian medical staff from approaching him, and the army took him away. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Fahed Muhammad Walid al-Astal
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers  gunfire during a demonstration near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza a while several dozen meters away from the fence. Had thrown stones and a Molotov cocktail at soldiers standing on the other side of the fence. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Yusra Muhammad 'Awwad a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with two of her minor children. Her husband, who was wounded, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. Her brother-in-law, his wife and three of their minor children, two of them toddlers, were also killed in the attack, and 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded

Name: Rasmi Salem 'Odeh a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed, along with his wife and three of his minor children, two of them toddlers. His brother, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. The brother s wife and their two young children were also killed and 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded.

Name: Maryam Salem Naser a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with her husband, their two toddlers, and her husband s son from a previous marriage. Her brother-in-law, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His wife and their two minor children were also killed and eight other people, seven of them minors, were wounded.

Name: Mu'az Muhammad Salem a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed, along with his mother and minor brother. His father, who was wounded, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His uncle and aunt and three of his minor cousins, two of them toddlers, were also killed in the attack, and eight other people, including seven minors, were wounded.

Name: Wasim Muhammad Salem a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed, along with his mother and minor brother. His father, who was wounded, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His uncle and aunt and three of his minor cousins, two of them toddlers, were also killed in the attack, and eight other people, including seven minors, were wounded.

Name: Muhannad Rasmi Salem a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed along with his father, his father s wife and two of his toddler siblings when the family homes were bombed. His uncle, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His aunt and two of his minor cousins were wounded along with eight other people, including seven minors, were wounded.

Name: Salem Rasmi Salem a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed along with his parents and two of his minor siblings, one of them a toddler, when the family homes were bombed. His uncle, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His aunt and two of his minor cousins were wounded along with 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded.

Name: Firas Rasmi Salem a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed along with his parents and two of his minor siblings, one of them a toddler, when the family homes were bombed. His uncle, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His aunt and two of his minor cousins were wounded along with 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded.

Name: Muhammad Salem 'Odeh a-Sawarkah
Notes: Wounded in an attack on the family homes in which his wife, two of his minor children, his brother, his brother's wife and three of his minor nephews, two of them toddlers, were killed. Eight others, including seven minors, were also wounded in the attack.

Name: Ahmad Hassan Yusef al-Kurdi
Notes: Killed with another Popular Resistance Committee military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Muhammad Hassan Muhammad Abu Mu'amar
Notes: Killed with another Popular Resistance Committee military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Islam Raafat Muhammad 'Ayad
Notes: Killed with his father and minor brother while riding a motorcycle in front his mother s house .

Name: Raafat Muhammad Suliman 'Ayad
Notes: Killed with two of his children, one of them a minor, while riding a motorcycle in front of his ex-wife s house.

Name: Amir Raafat Muhammad 'Ayad
Notes: Killed with his father and brother while riding a motorcycle in front of his father s ex-wife s house .

Name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Suliman Shurab
Notes: Killed on farmland in Khan Yunes with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative was wounded in the attack.

Name: Haitham Hafez Muhammad al-Bakri
Notes: Killed on farmland in Khan Yunes with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative was wounded in the attack.

Name: Mahmoud Daham Mahmoud Hathat
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in an attack on a carpentry shop that also killed three of the owners  sons, two of them minors. Two other people were wounded in the attack.

Name: Ibrahim Ayman Fathi 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed with two of his brothers, one of them a minor, and two Islamic Jihad military wing operatives in an attack on his father s carpentry shop, where he worked. Two other people were wounded in the attack.

Name: Isma'il Ayman Fathi 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed with two of his brothers, one of them a minor, and two Islamic Jihad military wing operatives in an attack on his father s carpentry shop, where he worked. Two other people were wounded in the attack.

Name: Ahmad Ayman Fathi 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed with two of his minor brothers and two Islamic Jihad military wing operatives in an attack on his father s carpentry shop, where he worked. Two other people were wounded in the attack.

Name: Soheil Khader Khalil Qanitah
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in an attack on a carpentry shop that also killed three of the owners  sons, two of them minors. Two other people were wounded in the attack.

Name: 'Alaa Jaber 'Abed Shteiwi
Notes: Killed on farmland in a-Zeitun neighborhood while taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Raed Rafiq Ahmad a-Sarsawi
Notes: Wounded while riding a motorcycle with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in the a-Zeitun neighborhood. The other operative was killed on the spot. The two were shot after taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Muamen Muhammad Salman Qadum
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in the a-Zeitun neighborhood. The other operative was wounded and died of his wounds on 29 November 2019. The two were shot after taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Yusef Rizeq Khalil Abu Kamil
Notes: Killed on farmland in the a-Tufah neighborhood while taking part in firing rockets at Israel along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was wounded in the incident.

Name: Khaled Mu'awad Salem Faraj
Notes: Killed on farmland in al-Mughraqa while taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: 'Abd a-Salam Ramadan Ahmad Ahmad
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: 'Abdallah 'Awad Sakeb al-Balbisi
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while the two were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Wael 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Abdallah 'Abd a-Nabi
Notes: Killed with two other Fatah military wing operatives while they were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Jihad Amin Ahmad Abu Khater
Notes: Killed with two other Fatah military wing operatives while they were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Rani Fayez Rajab Abu a-Naser
Notes: Killed with two other Fatah military wing operatives while they were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel.

Name: Zaki 'Adnan Muhammad Ghanam
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while both were taking part in firing rockets toward Israel. Three more Islamic Jihad military wing operatives were wounded in the attack.

Name: Bahaa Salim Hassan Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Senior operative. Killed with his wife when their house was bombed. Four of his children were wounded in the bombing, two of them minors, along with three more people.

Name: Asmaa Muhammad Hassan Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed. Her husband, a senior operative in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad was also killed in the attack, and four of their children were wounded, two of them minors, along with three other people.

Name: Ibrahim Ahmad 'Abd a-Latif a-Dabus
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative while riding a motorcycle in the a-Salatin neighborhood after the two took part in firing rockets toward Israel. Died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad 'Abdallah a-Shihri
Notes: Wounded in an attack on a house where he was staying. Died of his wounds shortly after. Another person was injured in the attack.

Name: 'Alaa Hani Hamadah al-'Abasi
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests, when he was about 200 meters from the Gaza perimeter fence north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence, and some also launched incendiary balloons. Remained in a coma after his injury.

Name: 'Alaa Nizar 'Ayesh Hamdan
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces when he was about 100 meters from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence east of Jabalya Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the protesters threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Died of his wounds shortly after

Name: Saher 'Awadallah Jaber 'Othman
Notes: Hit in the chest by Israeli security forces  gunfire while about 100 meters away from the Gaza Perimeter Fence during the March of Return Protests near the fence, east of the city of Rafah. Thousands took part in the protest. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones, improvised grenades and Molotov Cocktails at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence. and some launched incendiary balloons.

Name: 'Ali Sami 'Ali al-Ashqar
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces  gunfire at the March of Return Protests near the Gaza Perimeter Fence, east of Jabalya Refugee Camp. Thousands took part in the protest. At the demonstration, al-Ashqar threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence. Some of the other protesters threw stones, improvised grenades and IEDs at the troops.

Name: Khaled Abu Baker Muhammad a-Reb'i
Notes: Hit in the chest by Israeli security forces  gunfire at the March of Return Protests near the Gaza Perimeter Fence, east of Gaza City. Thousands took part in the protest. Died of his wounds shortly after. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones, improvised grenades and IEDs at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Badr a-Din Nabil Musa Abu Musa
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces' gunfire at the March of Return Protests near the Gaza Perimeter Fence, north of the town of Khuza'ah. Thousands took part in the protest. At the protest, he threw stones and a Molotov cocktail at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Mahmoud 'Adel Sa'ed al-Walaydeh
Notes: Killed with a Hamas military branch operative and a Fatah military branch operative when the Israeli military fired a missile from a helicopter and a tank shell at them near the Gaza Perimeter Fence after they tried to approach the fence with two other operatives, who were injured. Red Crescent medical crews were not allowed to approach the spot for several hours.

Name: Muhammad Farid Suliman Abu Namus
Notes: Killed with an Islamic Jihad military branch operative and a Fatah military branch operative when the Israeli military fired a missile from a helicopter and a tank shell at them near the Gaza Perimeter Fence after they tried to approach the fence with two other operatives, who were injured. Red Crescent medical crews were not allowed to approach the spot for several hours.

Name: Muhammad Samir 'Abd al-Jawad a-Taramsi
Notes: Killed with a Hamas military branch operative and an Islamic Jihad military branch operative when the Israeli military fired a missile from a helicopter and a tank shell at them near the Gaza Perimeter Fence after they tried to approach the fence with two other operatives, who were injured. Red Crescent medical crews were not allowed to approach the spot for several hours.

Name: Marwan Khaled Abd al-Ghani Naser
Notes: Hit by soldiers  gunfire after he approached the Gaza Perimeter fence and fired at them. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: 'Abdallah Isma'il 'Alian al-Hamaydah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with three other armed individuals after, according to the military, they tried to enter Israel. According to media reports, the men threw a grenade at the soldiers and fired at them, and one of them managed to cross the Gaza Perimeter fence. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abdallah Ashraf 'Abed al-Ghamri
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with three other armed individuals after, according to the military, they tried to enter Israel. According to media reports, the men threw a grenade at the soldiers and fired at them, and one of them managed to cross the Gaza Perimeter fence. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Rashad Saleh Suliman al-Badini
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with three other armed individuals after, according to the military, they tried to enter Israel. According to media reports, the men threw a grenade at the soldiers and fired at them, and one of them managed to cross the Gaza Perimeter fence. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad Ayman Musa al-'Adini
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with three other armed individuals after, according to the military, they tried to enter Israel. According to media reports, the men threw a grenade at the soldiers and fired at them, and one of them managed to cross the Gaza Perimeter fence. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad 'Abdallah al-Qara
Notes: Hit in the stomach by Israeli security forces' gunfire during the March of Return Protests, attended by thousands of protesters, near the concertina barbed wire fence, north of the town of Khuza'ah. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the Gaza Perimeter Fence.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Sabri al-Adham
Notes: Member of the military wing of Hamas, shot when he approached the perimeter fence and attempted, as part of his function, to prevent two youths from crossing the fence and entering Israeli territory.

Name: 'Abdallah Jum'ah Ahmad 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones, improvised grenades and IEDs at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Mahmoud Subhi Khamis 'Issa
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative on farmland east of the refugee camp. A third operative was injured.

Name: Fawzi 'Abd al-Halim Fawzi Bawadi
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative on farmland east of the refugee camp. A third operative was injured.

Name: 'Abdallah 'Abd a-Rahim Mustafa al-Madhun
Notes: Killed together with his sister-in-law, who was heavily pregnant, in an airstrike on his family s home. Also injured in the airstrike were his father and a neighbor, both of whom succumbed to their wounds shortly after, and six minors.

Name: Amani 'Atfat Sha'ban al-Madhun
Notes: Was heavily pregnant. Killed by shrapnel in an airstrike on her family s home as was her brother-in-law, an Islamic Jihad military branch operative. Also injured in the airstrike were her father-in-law and a neighbor, both of whom succumbed to their wounds shortly after, and six minors.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahim Mustafa Taha al-Madhun
Notes: Hit by shrapnel while sitting in his shop, in an airstrike on his adjacent home. He succumbed to his wounds shortly after. The airstrike killed his son, an Islamic Jihad military branch operative, and his heavily pregnant daughter-in-law. Also injured in the airstrike was neighbor, who succumbed to his wounds shortly after, and six minors.

Name: Fadi Ragheb Yusef Badran
Notes: Injured in courtyard of his home in an airstrike on the nearby home of the al-Madhun family, and succumbed to his wounds shortly after. In the al-Madhun home three people were killed   the father, a son who was an Islamic Jihad military branch operative, and a daughter-in-law, who was heavily pregnant   and six minors were injured.

Name: 'Ali Ahmad 'Ali 'Abd al-Jawad
Notes: Killed by shrapnel while in the offices of an NGO he ran on the ground floor of a building that was targeted by three bombs. Two other people were killed and another four injured in the airstrike.

Name: Musa Hussein Lafy Mu'amar
Notes: Injured while at a coffee shop in the basement of a building that was targeted by three bombs. He succumbed to his wounds shortly after. Two other people were killed and another four injured in the airstrike.

Name: Hani Hamdan Salman Abu Sh'ar
Notes: Injured by shrapnel while at a coffee shop in the basement of a building that was targeted by three bombs. He succumbed to his wounds shortly after. Two other people were killed and another four injured in the airstrike.

Name: Mahmoud Samir Muhammad Abu 'Armaneh
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative while they were launching rockets at Israel.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Nabi Mahmoud Abu 'Armaneh
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative while they were launching rockets at Israel.

Name: 'Abdallah Nofal Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Killed together with a senior Islamic Jihad military branch operative during a military branch offensive.

Name: Bilal Mahmoud 'Abed al-Bana
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military branch operative. Killed together with another military branch operative during a military branch offensive.

Name: Maria Ahmad Ramadan al-Ghazali
Notes: Three-month-old baby girl. Killed together with both her parents and three members of the Abu al-Jidyan family, one a minor, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower.

Name: Ahmad Ramadan Rajab al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed together with his wife, three-month-old daughter, and three members of the Abu al-Jidyan family, one a minor, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower.

Name: Iman 'Abdallah Musa Asraf (al-Ghazali)
Notes: Officer in the Hamas regime police. Killed together with her husband, three-month-old daughter, and three members of the Abu al-Jidyan family, one a minor, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower.

Name: Talal 'Atiyyah Muhammad Abu al-Jidyan
Notes: Killed together with his wife, son (a minor), and three members of the al-Ghazali family, including a three-month-old baby girl, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower. His body and that of his wife were located only the day after the bombing.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Talal 'Atiyyah Abu al-Jidyan
Notes: Killed together with both his parents and three members of the al-Ghazali family, including a three-month-old baby girl, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower. His parents  bodies were located only the day after the bombing.

Name: Raghdah Muhammad Mahmoud Abu al-Jidyan
Notes: Killed together with her husband, son (a minor), and three members of the al-Ghazali family, including a three-month-old baby girl, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower. Her body and that of her husband were located only the day after the bombing.

Name: Hamed Ahmad 'Abed al-Khudari
Notes: Killed driving his car in eastern Gaza City.

Name: Iyad 'Abdallah Shreiqi a-Sharihi
Notes: Killed by a missile which hit farmland east of al-Maghazi Refugee Camp. He was there with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative, who was wounded.

Name: 'Imad Muhammad Rajab Nasir
Notes: Killed while he and other operatives of Humat al-Aqsa s military branch were attempting to fire rockets. Another operative was injured.

Name: Khaled Muhammad Silmi Abu Qleiq
Notes: Killed by a rocket at the entrance to a home he was guarding, after he and the security guard of a nearby banquet hall, who was injured by the rocket, fled the security booth which had been targeted several minutes earlier.

Name: 'Abdallah Ibrahim Mahmoud Abu Maluh
Notes: Killed by a missile along with another Hamas military branch operative while on guard duty at a Hamas military branch training base. Three other operatives sustained injuries.

Name: 'Alaa Hassan 'Ali al-Bubali
Notes: Killed by a missile along with other Hamas military branch operative while on guard duty at a Hamas military branch training base. Three other operatives sustained injuries.

Name: Ramzi Rohi Hassan 'Abdu
Notes: Wounded in the head by security forces  gunfire while about 100 meters away from the perimeter fence during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij R.C; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence, and some also launched balloon bombs.

Name: Raed Khalil Mahmoud Abu Teir
Notes: Shot in the pelvis by Israeli security forces, several dozen meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the perimeter fence, east of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took park in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Myasarah Musa Suliman Abu Shaluf
Notes: Hit in the waist by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya Refugee Camp. He was shot as he stood by the fence after cutting it. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence and launched incendiary balloons. Abu Shaluf succumbed to his injuries later that day.

Name: Tamer Hashem 'Issa Abu al-Kheir
Notes: Hit by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the town of Khuza ah; hundreds took part in the protest. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Fares Yusef Fares Abu Hajras
Notes: Hit in the stomach by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took park in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones, IEDS and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Bilal Mahmoud Sha'ban a-Najar
Notes: Hit in the chest by Israeli security forces  gunfire when he was a few dozen meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, having crossed it and then returned into the Gaza Strip, during the Return Protests near the perimeter fence, east of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took park in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters threw stones, IEDS and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Adham Nidal Saqer 'Amarah
Notes: Killed when a stun grenade fired by Israeli security forces hit him, lodging in his face during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires, launched incendiary balloons and threw stones, improvised grenades and IEDs at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Muhammad Jihad Jawdat Sa'ed
Notes: Used crutches to walk. Fatally shot by Israeli security forces during the nighttime Return Protests (the Night Confusion) near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; hundreds took part in the protest. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones, improvised grenades and IEDs at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Habib Hamzah 'Abd al-Fatah al-Masri
Notes: Hit by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the nighttime Return Protests (the Night Confusion) near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Beit Hanoun; hundreds took part in the protest. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Nidal 'Abd al-Karim Ahmad Shatat
Notes: Shot in the armpit by Israeli security forces when he was several dozen meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee camp; thousands took park in the protests. Name: Jihad Munir Khaled Hararah
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protest.
