Name: Tamer Khaled Mustafa 'Arafat
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protest. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires, threw stones, IEDs and improvised grenades at Israeli troops stationed on the other side of the fence, and some also launched balloon bombs. Name: Seif a-Din 'Imad Naser Abu Zeid
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli security forces during the nighttime Return Protests (the Night Confusion) near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; hundreds took part in the protest. Name: Musa Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Musa

Name: Yusef Sa'id Hussein a-Dayah
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces a few dozen meters from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones, IEDs and improvised grenades   some of which landed in the Gaza Strip   at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Bassam Sami 'Othman Safi
Notes: Injured when a teargas canister fired by Israeli security forces hit him, lodging in his face. He was 150-200 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence when he was hit, during the Return Protests near the perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Had remained unconscious since his injury.

Name: Hassan Iyad 'Abd al-Fatah Shalabi
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces while standing about 200 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence. Shot during the Return Protests near the fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones, IEDs and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Hamzah Muhammad Rushdi Shteiwi
Notes: Hit in the neck by Israeli security forces  gunfire while about 100 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence during the Return Protests near the fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones, IEDs and improvised grenades   some of which landed in the Gaza Strip   at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence. He succumbed to his wounds shortly after.

Name: Hassan Nabil Ahmad Nofal
Notes: Hit in the head by a teargas canister fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. At the demonstration, some protesters torched tires and threw stones, IEDs and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence. Had remained unconscious since his injury.

Name: Ahmad Ghazi A'bbas Abu Jabal
Notes: Hit in the thigh by Israeli security forces  gunfire when he was several dozen meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, north of the town of a-Sayfa; hundreds took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires; Abu Jabal and other demonstrators threw stones at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Ihab 'Atallah Hussein A'bed
Notes: Hit in the chest by Israeli security forces  gunfire while throwing stones at the Gaza perimeter fence from several dozen meters away, during the Return Protests held east of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Mahmoud al-'Abed Muhammad a-Nabahin

Name: Samir Ghazi Mahmoud a-Nabahin
Notes: Injured when a tear-gas canister fired by Israeli security forces lodged in his face, during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abd a-Ra'uf Isma'il Muhammad Salhah

During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones, explosive devices and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Amal Mustafa Ahmad a-Taramsi
Notes: Died of her wounds shortly after being hit in the neck by Israeli security forces' gunfire while about 200 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence during the Return Protests near the fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones, explosive devices and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Karam Muhammad Nu'man Fayad
Notes: Intellectually disabled. Shot in the head by Israeli security forces when he was approx. 150 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. At the protest, some demonstrators crossed the fence into Israel and then back into the Gaza Strip, some torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abd al-'Aziz Ibrahim 'Abd al-'Aziz Abu Shria'h
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. At the protest, some demonstrators torched tires and threw stones, explosive devices and improvised grenades   some of which landed in the Gaza Strip   at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Muhammad Mu'in Khalil Jahjouh
Notes: Shot in the back by Israeli security forces when he was at least 100 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Ayman Munir Muhammad Shbeir
Notes: Shot in the upper body by Israeli security forces when he was with a group of protesters who were trying to damage the concertina wire fence, at a spot several dozen meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. At the protest, some demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Maher 'Atiyyah Muhammad Yasin
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli security forces when he was approx. 350 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence, during the Return Protests near the fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. At the protest, some demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Died of his injuries later that day.

Name: Ahmad Yasser Sabri Abu 'Abed
Notes: Injured in the head and upper body by shrapnel from Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. At the protest, some demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Remained in a coma after his injury. His father was injured in the hand by shrapnel.

Name: Nawaf Ahmad Muhammad al-'Attar
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers when he approached the perimeter fence near Gaza s northern shore.

Name: Khaled Akram Yusef M'aruf
Notes: Killed by missile when he and other Popular Resistance Committee activists fired mortars toward Israel.

Name: Khaled Riyad Ahmad a-Sultan
Notes: Killed by a missile near a farmland in Beit Lahiya. A seven-year-old boy was wounded in the incident.

Name: Muhammad Zakaria Isma'il a-Tatari
Notes: Killed by a missile together with another Popular Front military wing operative when guarding a Popular Front compound. Two other operatives were wounded in the incident.

Name: Muhammad Zuhdi Hassan 'Odeh
Notes: Killed by a missile together with another Popular Front military wing operative when guarding a Popular Front compound. Two other operatives were wounded in the incident.

Name: Hamad Muhammad Musa a-Nahal
Notes: Killed by a missile while trying to launch rockets at Israel from farmland northeast of Rafah together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was wounded and died the next day.

Name: Musa Iyad 'Ali 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Hit by a missile while trying to launch rockets at Israel from farmland northeast of Rafah together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was killed instantaneously.

Name: 'Omar Naji Muslem Abu Khater
Notes: Killed together with three Hamas operatives and one Popular Resistance Committee activist after plain clothed soldiers who reportedly entered Gaza disguised as members of a medical aid organization were exposed at a Hamas checkpoint in Bani Suheila. A gun battle ensued, during which two Hamas military branch operatives were killed, one of them senior. According to the military, shots fired by an Israeli officer killed another Israeli officer and moderately wounded a third officer. To allow their vehicles to escape, an aircraft fired missiles.

Name: Nur a-Din Muhammad Salamah Barakah
Notes: Senior Hamas military branch operative. Shot and killed together with another Hamas military branch operative by plain-clothed Israeli soldiers during a gun battle at a Hamas checkpoint in Bani Suheila. According to the military, shots fired by an Israeli officer killed another Israeli officer and moderately wounded a third officer. The soldiers reportedly entered Gaza disguised as members of a medical aid organization. To allow their vehicles to escape, an aircraft fired missiles. Four more Hamas military branch operatives and an operative of the Popular Resistance Committees were killed in the incident.

Name: Muhammad Majed Muhammad al-Qara
Notes: Shot and killed together with a a senior Hamas military branch operative by plain-clothed Israeli soldiers during a gun battle at a Hamas checkpoint in Bani Suheila. Four more Hamas military branch operatives and an operative of the Popular Resistance Committees were killed in the incident.

Name: 'Alaa a-Din Fawzi Muhammad Fseifes
Notes: Killed together with three Hamas operatives and one Popular Resistance Committee activist after plain clothed soldiers who reportedly entered Gaza disguised as members of a medical aid organization were exposed at a Hamas checkpoint in Bani Suheila. According to the military, shots fired by an Israeli officer killed another Israeli officer and moderately wounded a third officer. To allow their vehicles to escape, an aircraft fired missiles.

Name: Rami Wael Ishaq Qahman
Notes: Shot in the back of the neck by Israeli security forces' gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Muhammad 'Alaa Mahmoud Abu Shirbin
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli soldiers after approaching the Gaza Perimeter fence along with several other young men, east of al-Maghazi R.C.

Name: 'Imad Khalil Ibrahim Shahin
Notes: Shot and wounded in the right thigh by soldiers when trying to breach the fence with an axe together with two friends, one of whom was also carrying an axe. The other was wounded by shrapnel. Evacuated to a hospital in Israel where he died of his wounds.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Hai Ahmad Abu 'Abadi
Notes: Hit in the chest by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of a-Saifa; thousands took part in the protests. Name: 'Abd al-Hamid Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aziz Abu Daher
Notes: Killed together with two other teenagers from a missile strike near the fence. Palestinian ambulances were kept waiting for some 90 minutes before Israel allowed them to look for the three.

Name: Khaled Bassam Mahmoud Abu Sa'id
Notes: Killed together with two other teenagers from a missile strike near the fence. Palestinian ambulances were kept waiting for some 90 minutes before Israel allowed them to look for the three.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim 'Abdallah a-Satari
Notes: Killed together with two other teenagers from a missile strike near the fence. Palestinian ambulances were kept waiting for some 90 minutes before Israel allowed them to look for the three.

Name: Mujahed Ziad Zaki 'Aqel
Notes: Hit in the thigh by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Yihya Bader Muhammad al-Hasanat
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp, during which he cut the fence; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Ahmad Khaled Salman a-Najar
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by Israeli security forces while he was throwing stones at them during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. Name: 'Ayesh Ghassan 'Ayesh Sha'th

Name: Karam Ibrahim 'Ali Abu 'Arafat

Name: Ramzi Muhammad Salem a-Najar
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah. According to the military, he and another Palestinian were trying to enter Israel with an axe. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ruzan Ashraf 'Abd al-Qader a-Najar
Notes: Paramedic. Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Name: Zakaria Sayed Mustafa Bashbash
Notes: Injured in the upper body by Israeli security forces  fire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; hundreds to thousands took part in the protests. Name: Muhammad Ma'sud Ahmad 'Abdallah a-Radi'
Notes: Killed by a tank shell fired towards a lookout post of the Hamas military wing. Earlier, militants had fired from the post towards soldiers who had detained two Palestinians attempting to enter Israel. According to the military, the two were armed with knives and incendiary devices.

Name: 'Abd al-Halim 'Abd al-Karim a-Naqah
Notes: Killed when tank shells hit a lookout post of the Islamic Jihad s military wing. According to the military, the shells were fired in response to the laying of an explosive device on the Gaza perimeter fence opposite the lookout post. The shelling killed another militant, and a third died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Hussein Samir Hussein al-'Amur
Notes: Killed when tank shells hit a lookout post of the Islamic Jihad s military wing. According to the military, the shells were fired in response to the laying of an explosive device on the Gaza perimeter fence opposite the lookout post. Notes: Fatally shot with his cousin by Israeli soldiers near the town of al-Qararah. According to the military, the two young men crossed the Gaza perimeter fence and threw explosive devices at soldiers. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Yusef Ahmad 'Atwah al-'Amawi
Notes: Fatally shot with his cousin by Israeli soldiers near the town of al-Qararah. According to the military, the two young men crossed the Gaza perimeter fence and threw explosive devices at soldiers. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Yusef Jasser Yusef Abu Jazar
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers. The military claimed that Abu Jazar was shot after trying to enter Israel with another boy. He was unarmed and posed no risk to anyone at the time he was shot. Israel held his body until 22 April 2021, when it was returned to his family.

Name: 'Azzam Hilal Riyad 'Aweidah
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, noth of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abd a-Salam 'Eid Zuhdi Baker

Name: Anas Shawqi Muhammad Abu 'Aser
Notes: Hit by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. According to the military, during the protest, demonstrators tried to cross the fence, and threw explosive devices, grenades and Molotov cocktails.

Name: Muhammad Amin Ahmad al-Moqayad
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. According to the military, during the protest, demonstrators tried to cross the fence, and threw explosive devices, grenades and Molotov cocktails.

Name: Ahmad Rashad 'Abdallah al-'Athamneh
Notes: Shot in the torso by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Ayub Ayub
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. B Tselem s investigation and video footage aired by the media indicate that Ayub was about 200 meters away from the fence when teargas was fired at that area. He fled from there, without moving any nearer to the fence, and was then shot and killed.

Name: Ahmad Nabil Muhammad 'Aqel
Notes: Used crutches. Shot in the head by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Sa'ed 'Abd al-Majid 'Abd al-'Aal Abu Taha
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abdallah Muhammad Jebril a-Shamali
Notes: Hit by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Ashraf Hassan Abu Hussein
Notes: Photojournalist. Shot in the stomach and chest by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. On video footage posted on social media, a shot is heard and then Abu Hussein is seen falling to the ground, wearing a press vest. He later died of his injuries in a hospital in Israel.

Name: Islam Mahmoud Rushdi Hirzallah
Notes: Mortally injured by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. According to the military, an explosive device placed near the fence detonated. Died of his injuries later that day.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad 'Ayesh Hajilah
Notes: Killed east of Gaza City during an airstrike by the Israeli Air Force. Another Palestinian was injured in the same airstrike. The IDF Spokesperson stated that the airstrike was carried out in response to Hamas military branch operatives firing at an aircraft that was making a strike on Hamas military branch posts.

Name: 'Abdallah Muhammad 'Abdallah a-Shihri
Notes: Sustained fatal chest wounds from Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Died of his injuries later that day.

Name: Hussein Muhammad 'Adnan Madi
Notes: Shot in the stomach by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Mujahed Nabil Marwan al-Khudari

Name: Ahmad 'Omar Muhammad 'Arafah
Notes: Shot in the back and hand by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Tahrir Mahmoud Sa'id Wahbah
Notes: Deaf. Hit by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Video footage aired by the media shows Wahbah standing with his back to the soldiers, waving his arms, when he was shot.

Name: Sari Walid Muhammad Abu 'Odeh
Notes: Killed together with Fatah - Nabil Mas'ud Brigades military wing operative from a tank shell strike near the perimeter fence north of Beit Hanoun, as they attempted to evacuate two youths wounded by soldiers  gunfire during an attempt to enter Israel.

Name: Hamdan Isma'il Saber Abu 'Amshah
Notes: Killed together with a Hamas military wing operative from a tank shell strike near the perimeter fence north of Beit Hanoun, as they attempted to evacuate two youths wounded by soldiers  gunfire during an attempt to enter Israel.

Name: Shadi Hamdan 'Ali al-Kashef
Notes: A deaf man, wounded in the head from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Ibrahim Salah Ibrahim Abu Sh'ar
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Amin Mahmoud Hamad Abu Mu'amar
Notes: Fatally wounded from shots fired by Isralei security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of the city of Rafah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Fares Mahmoud Muhammad a-Raqab
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza'ah; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Marwan 'Awwad Hamad Qdeih
Notes: Wounded in both legs from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza'ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Jihad Zuheir Salman Abu Jamus
Notes: Fatally wounded in the head from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town Khuza'ah; thousands took part in the protests. Abu Jamus was shot when he was approximately 100m away from the fence. During the protest he had torched tires and thrown stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Muhammad Muhareb Muhammad a-Rabiya'h
Notes: Killed together with a Hamas military branch operative, near the security fence, east of Juhor a-Dik, after soldiers shot live ammunition and tank shells. The army claims that the two shot at soldiers, and in response, shots were also fired from an aircraft. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Mus'ab Zuheir Anis a-Salul
Notes: Killed together with a Fatah military branch operative, near the security fence, east of Juhor a-Dik, after soldiers shot live ammunition and tank shells. The army claims that the two shot at soldiers, and in response, shots were also fired from an aircraft. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Omar Wahid Nasrallah Abu Samur
Notes: Killed from a tank shell that hit his chest and abdomen while he was on farmland, some 750m away from the perimeter fence, east of al-Qararah. Another Palestinian was hurt in the shelling.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim 'Ashur 'Odeh
Notes: Shot and killed by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators orched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Jihad Ahmad Muhammad Fareinah
Notes: Shot and killed by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. Notes: Shot and killed by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Muhammad Na'im Muhammad Abu O'mar
Notes: Shot and killed by israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abd al-Fatah Bahajat 'Abd al-Fatah 'Abd a-Nabi
Notes: Shot in the back of the head by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. A video circulated by the media shows 'Abd a-Nabi being shot in the back while running and holding a tire.

Name: Thaer Muhammad 'Abd a-Ra'uf Rab'ah
Notes: Wounded from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Isareli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Bader Fayeq Ibrahim a-Sabagh
Notes: Shot and killed by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. Name: Muhammad Kamal Muhammad a-Najar
Notes: Shot in the back by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Naji 'Abdallah Shehdeh Abu Hjeir
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: 'Abd al-Qader Mardi Suliman al-Hawajri
Notes: Fatally wounded in the abdomen from shots fired by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij R.C.; thousands took part in the protests. During the protest, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. Succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Ahmad Jihad Ahmad al-'Aidy
Notes: Hit in the head by Israeli security forces  gunfire during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence. Remained in a coma after his injury.

Name: Muhammad 'Ata 'Abd al-Mawla Abu Jame'
Notes: Injured in the buttocks by soldiers  fire while working his land approx. 200 meters from the perimeter fence. Died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Isma'il Saleh Muhammad Abu Ryalah
Notes: Shot by soldiers from a navy vessel that was in pursuit of his fishing boat. Died of his wounds later that day. Another two fishermen were wounded in the shooting.

Name: Salem Muhammad Suliman Sabah
Notes: Wounded by live fire when he and three other youths were several dozen meters away from the perimeter fence, trying to cross into Israel to look for work. One of the other youths was killed and two were wounded from a mortar shell that was fired at them.

Name: 'Abdallah Ayman Suliman Irmeilat
Notes: Wounded by live fire when he and three other youths were several dozen meters away from the perimeter fence, trying to cross into Israel to look for work. One of the other youths was killed and two were wounded from a mortar shell that was fired at them.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad 'Abd Rabo Abu Hilu
Notes: Sustained a critical gunshot wound when Israeli soldiers shot him in the back of the head during a protest near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp. During the protest, demonstrators threw stones at soldiers who were on the other side of the fence. Abu Hilu was about 15 meters away from the fence.

Name: Amir 'Abd al-Hamid Msa'ed Abu Masa'ed
Notes: Shot in the armpit by Israeli soldiers during a protest near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp, when he was at a spot about 50-70 meters away from the fence. During the protest, Palestinian youths threw stones at soldiers who were on the other side of the fence.

Name: Jamal Muhammad Jamal Musleh
Notes: Shot and injured in the back by soldiers during a demonstration in which he threw stones at soldiers who were on the other side of the Gaza perimeter fence.

Name: Muhammad Nabil Muhammad Muheisen
Notes: Shot dead in the thigh by soldiers during a demonstration near the Nahal Oz checkpoint. In the demonstration, Palestinians threw stones toward soldiers on the other side of the Gaza perimeter fence.

Name: Zakaria Adham Hussein al-Kafarneh
Notes: Shot dead in the chest by soldiers during a demonstration near Erez checkpoint, while he was some fifty meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence trying to damage the barbed wire that was laid there. Soldiers fired tear gas at the young men who carried him to an ambulance waiting some 300 meters from the fence.

Name: Sharif al-'Abed Muhammad Shalash
Notes: Shot and injured in the abdomen by soldiers during a demonstration near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of Jabalya Refugee Camp. Earlier on in the demonstration, he had thrown stones at soldiers on the other side of the fence, but at the time of the shooting was sitting some 200 meters from the fence and was not throwing stones.

Name: Ibrahim Nayef Ibrahim Abu Thurayyah
Notes: Double amputee. Shot dead in the head by soldiers during a demonstration near the Nahal Oz checkpoint, while he was about twenty meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence. During the demonstration, Palestinians threw stones toward soldiers on the other side of the fence. Another demonstrator was shot dead earlier.

Name: Yasser Naji Ibrahim Sukar
Notes: Shot dead in the head by soldiers during a demonstration near the Nahal Oz checkpoint. In the demonstration, Palestinians threw stones toward soldiers on the other side of the Gaza perimeter fence. Another demonstrator was shot dead later.

Name: Mahmoud 'Abd al-Majid Salem al-Masri
Notes: Critically wounded in the thigh when shot by soldiers at a protest near the Gaza perimeter fence. During the protest, he had thrown stones at the soldiers from a distance of 20-30 meters away from the fence.

Name: Muhammad Sami Hashem a-Dahduh
Notes: Shot and injured in the neck by soldiers during a demonstration near the Nahal Oz checkpoint. In the demonstration he threw stones toward soldiers on the other side of the Gaza perimeter fence, from about 10 meters away from the fence.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad 'Abd al-Qader al-'Atal
Notes: Killed together with another Hamas military branch operative in the bombing of a Hamas military branch training camp in the south of Gaza City.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Jaber Sha'ban a-Safdi
Notes: Killed together with another Hamas military branch operative in the bombing of a Hamas military branch training camp in the south of Gaza City.

Name: Hassan Ramadan Hassan Abu Hasanein
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (two Hamas military branch operatives and four Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: 'Arafat 'Abdallah Abu Murshid
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (two Hamas military branch operatives and four Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: Musbah Fayeq Musbah Shbeir
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (a Hamas military branch operative and five Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: Husam Jihad 'Abdallah a-Smeiri
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (two Hamas military branch operatives and four Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: Ahmad Mahmoud Ibrahim Abu 'Armaneh
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (two Hamas military branch operatives and four Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: 'Omar Nassar Muhammad al-Falit
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (two Hamas military branch operatives and four Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: Muhammad Marwan Jamil al-Agha
Notes: Killed along with six other Palestinians (a Hamas military branch operative and five Islamic Jihad military branch operatives) during efforts to carry away the dead and wounded from a tunnel the Israeli military had bombed in Israeli territory, near Kibbutz Kissufim. The bombing killed five other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives in Israeli territory. Two days after the bombing, Israel stated it would not allow the evacuation of any other casualties.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Hussein Jaber Abu Hamisah
Notes: Shot and killed by soldiers who were approx. 50 meters away, during a protest near the Gaza perimeter fence east of al-Bureij Refugee Camp. During the protest, stones were thrown at soldiers on the other side of the fence. B Tselem s research indicates Abu Hamisah was not throwing stones when he was shot.

Name: 'Aead Khamis Mahmoud Jum'ah
Notes: Killed from a shot to the head fired by soldiers during a protest near the perimeter fence east of Jabalya RC. Rocks were thrown at soldiers standing on the other side of the fence during the protest. B Tselem s research indicates that Jum ah had been standing 150 meters away from the fence and did not throw rocks. 18 protesters, including one minor, were injured from the shooting.

Name: Fadi Ibrahim Isma'il a-Najar
Notes: Fatally shot in the abdomen by soldiers during protest near the perimeter fence east of Khuza'ah. During the protest, rocks were thrown at soldiers standing on the other side of the fence. B Tselem s research indicates a-Najar was standing about 150 meters away from the fence and did not throw rocks. Two protesters, including one minor, were injured from shrapnel.

Name: Muhammad Majed Fadel Baker
Notes: Injured by soldiers  fire from a navy vessel pursuing his fishing boat within the area in which the military permits Gaza fishermen to operate. He died of his wounds later that day.

Name: Yusef Sha'ban Ahmad Abu 'Athrah
Notes: Killed by a tank shell when he was approx. 300-400 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence. He and two other Palestinians were getting ready to cross the fence into Israel to seek work. Another Palestinian was injured by the shells.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Muhammad Abu S'ad
Notes: Critically injured when soldiers shot him in the chest from some 15 meters away after he went up to an opening in the fence, threw a clod of earth that hit a female soldier standing several meters away from him, and went back behind the fence. He died of his wounds a short while later. Another protester was hit in the hand by the gunfire, and another was hit in the head by a fired tear-gas canister.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Ahmad 'Abd al-Qader a-Dabagh
Notes: Killed by flare bomb shot by IDF soldier directly at his head, while posing no threat to anyone, during a protest near the Gaza perimeter fence, east of al-Bureij RC.

Name: Zanah 'Atiyyah Muhammad al-'Amur
Notes: Killed by a tank shell, while working in an agricultural field about half a kilometer from the perimeter fence. According to media reports, the Israeli military stated it had fired at people launching mortar shells. B Tselem s inquiry found that no mortars were fired from that area, either at the time she was killed on in the preceding days.

Name: Yasin Salman Musa Abu Khusah
Notes: Killed by a fragment of cement in an air strike on a Hamas military branch training camp located near his home. His sister was also critically wounded, dying of her wounds shortly thereafter. No military branch operatives were injured in the strike.

Name: Israa Salman Musa Abu Khusah
Notes: Critically injured by a fragment of cement in an air strike on a Hamas military branch training camp located near her home. Her brother was also killed in the strike. No military branch operatives were injured in the strike.

Name: Muhammad 'Adel Muhammad Abu Zayed
Notes: Killed by a gunshot wound to the head about 100 meters from the perimeter fence, while taking part in a demonstration, during which stones were thrown at soldiers taking cover behind dirt mounds on the other side of the fence. Later, another protester was shot dead at the same demonstration.

Name: Muhammad Majdi 'Azmi Qitah
Notes: Killed by a gunshot wound to the abdomen during a demonstration at which stones were thrown at soldiers taking cover behind dirt mounds on the other side of the perimeter fence. Earlier, another protester had also been shot and killed.

Name: Musa As'ad Salman Abu Z'eiter
Notes: Killed by a missile near the Gaza perimeter fence and the Gaza shoreline, where he had arrived in the company of other armed individuals carrying bombs. Two of the armed individuals were injured.

Name: Hani Rafiq Tawfiq Wahdan
Notes: Sustained a gunshot wound to the head during clashes with soldiers near the perimeter fence. In the course of the clashes, Palestinians threw stones at the soldiers. Shortly before the gunfire, they also lobbed two Molotov cocktails at the soldiers.

Name: Yusef Mubarak Bheiri Abu Sbeikhah
Notes: Critically wounded in the abdomen and thigh by soldiers  gunfire when he was tending a plot of land about 400 meters from the perimeter fence. At the time, a demonstration was underway at which stones were thrown at soldiers who were on the other side of the perimeter fence, behind sand mounds.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Sa'id al-Agha
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers at a protest near the perimeter fence. At the protest, stones were thrown at soldiers standing on the other side of the fence.

Name: Sami Shawqi Ahmad Madi
Notes: Sustained a gunshot wound to the chest at a protest in which stones were thrown at soldiers standing about 300 meters away, on the other side of the perimeter fence.

Name: Salamah Musa Muhammad Abu Jame'
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers at a protest near the perimeter fence with Gaza. He was approx. 50 meters away from the fence, throwing stones at soldiers who had taken cover behind a dirt mound on the other side of the fence.

Name: Ahmad Sharif al-'Abed a-Sarhi
Notes: Killed while in the company of other armed military branch operatives approximately 300 meters from the perimeter fence.

Name: Yihya Hashem Nimer Karirah
Notes: Mortally wounded by a gunshot wound to the head at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Another protester was killed at the demonstration.

Name: Mahmoud Hatem Muhammad Hamid
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the neck during a protest near the perimeter fence. Another protester was killed in the incident.

Name: Yihya 'Abd al-Qader Jaber Farhat
Notes: Killed during a protest near Erez Checkpoint.

Name: Rahaf Yihya Sa'di Hassan
Notes: Killed along with her mother when their home was bombed.

Name: Nur Rasmi Muhammad Hassan
Notes: Killed along with her three-year-old daughter when their home was bombed.

Name: Khalil Hassan Khalil Abu 'Obeid
Notes: Mortally wounded when hit by a tear-gas grenade that penetrated his body at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers.

Name: Khalil 'Omar Musa 'Othman
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the chest at a protest near the perimeter fence. Another protester was killed in the incident.

Name: Marwan Hisham Na'im Barbakh
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the chest at a protest near the perimeter fence. Another protester was killed in the incident.

Name: Shadi Husam a-Din Muthaffar Dawlah
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the stomach at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Three other protesters were killed along with him.

Name: Ahmad Yihya Mahmoud al-Hirbawi
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the stomach at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Three other protesters were killed along with him.

Name: 'Abd al-Majid Majdi 'Abd al-Majid al-Wahidi
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the neck at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Three other protesters were killed along with him.

Name: Ziad Nabil Ziad Sharaf
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the chest, at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Three other protesters were killed along with him.

Name: Jihad Zayed Salem A'beid
Notes: Mortally wounded during a protest near the perimeter fence at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Two other protesters were also killed in the incident.

Name: 'Adnan Musa Ahmad Abu 'Alayan
Notes: Killed after sustaining a gunshot wound to the head, at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Another protester was killed in the incident, and a third succumbed to his wounds the following day.

Name: Hamuda Hisham Muhammad Muhsein (a-Raqab)
Notes: Shot dead at a demonstration near the perimeter fence. During the demonstration, protesters threw stones at soldiers. Another protester was killed in the incident, and a third succumbed to his wounds the following day.

Name: Muhammad Hamed 'Adel al-Masri
Notes: Fatally wounded by gunshots fired by soldiers near the border fence. Pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital shortly thereafter. Prior to the shooting al-Masri attempted to break a military surveillance camera mounted on the fence.

Name: Tawfiq Sa'id Muhammad Abu Ryalah
Notes: Shot from a navy ship in the zone permitted to Gaza fishermen by the military.

Name: Taysir Yusef Muslem a-Smeiri
Notes: Killed outside his home, located approximately 500 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence. Approximately an hour before he was killed, a soldier was wounded by shots fired by armed militants who were near the town of Khuza'a, located more than 7 kilometers away from al-Qarara. After the soldier was wounded, the military fired at the Gaza perimeter fence area, hitting a-Sameiri.

Name: Fadel Muhammad Muhammad Halawah
Notes: Shot in the back by soldiers while he and another man were out bird-hunting with nets, approximately 20 meters west of the Gaza perimeter fence.

Name: Tamer Midhat Hassan Hamad
Notes: An electric company employee. Killed together with another worker while they were traveling in a company vehicle displaying the company flag. Three passersby were injured in the strike.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd al-Qader Daher
Notes: An electric company employee. Killed together with another worker while they were traveling in a company vehicle displaying the company flag. Three passersby were injured in the strike.

Name: Muhammad Husam Ahmad al-Barim
Notes: Killed together with his brother as they walked along the street by a missile fired at a passing motorbike.

Name: 'Omar Husam Ahmad al-Barim
Notes: Killed together with his brother as they walked along the street by a missile fired at a passing motorbike.

Name: Shadi Suliman 'Ali 'Aleiwa
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad when riding a motorcycle in the a-Sha'af neighborhood.

Name: Salem 'Abd al-Hamid Diab Muhmmadein
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad when riding a motorcycle in the a-Sha'af neighborhood.

Name: Ahmad Kamel 'Abd al-Karim Jarbo'a
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives near the Yusef a-Najar Hospital.

Name: Muhammad Saleh Mahmoud a-Riyati
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives near the Yusef a-Najar Hospital.

Name: Yusef Subhi Yusef Swelem (Ghanam)
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military branch operatives near the Yusef a-Najar Hospital.

Name: Hassan 'Omar Khalil al-Khawas
Notes: Killed with another Hamas armed wing operative near their homes on a-Nafak St.

Name: Muhammad Mu'in Radwan Abu 'Ajwah
Notes: Killed with another Hamas armed wing operative near their homes on a-Nafak St.

Name: Muhammad Majdi Muhammad a-Shawish
Notes: Killed on al-Qarman. Two other military branch operatives were injured.

Name: Yihya Farhan Ahmad Abu Jaber
Notes: Injured driving a taxi on Salah a-Din Street. His son, who was in the taxi with him, sustained moderate injuries.

Name: Ahmad Hassan Salem Hijazi
Notes: Killed with three other people, one of them a Saudi national, while riding in a car on a-Sahabeh Street.

Name: Ahmad Taysir Fahmi a-Dali
Notes: Killed with three other people, one of them a Saudi national, while riding in a car on a-Sahabeh Street.

Name: Bassem Hassan Salem Hijazi
Notes: Killed with three other people, one of them a Saudi national, while riding in a car on a-Sahabeh Street.

Name: Ousamah Hamdi 'Abd a-Latif a-Shalfouh
Notes: Killed when he went with another Hamas military branch operative to examine the damage their homes sustained.

Name: Ousamah Muhammad Sa'id Shbeir
Notes: Killed when he went with another Hamas military branch operative to examine the damage their homes sustained.

Name: Sa'ed Bassem 'Abed 'Ajur
Notes: Killed in his home in the neighborhood of a-Daraj. His father was wounded, and died about a week later

Name: Bassem 'Abed 'Odeh 'Ajur
Notes: Wounded in his home in the neighborhood of a-Daraj in the strike in which his son was killed.

Name: Farhanah Ibrahim Taleb al-'Attar
Notes: Killed when she returned to her home, which she had evacuated earlier, in order to take clothes.

Name: Raddad Ahmad Salim Tanburah
Notes: An employee of the municipal water department. Entered the sewage pipe tunnel close to his home to repair a fault. The house was bombed and he was killed with two of his children. Nine other members of the family were injured.

Name: Amneh Raddad Ahmad Tanburah
Notes: Killed with her father and brother when their home was bombed after the father entered the sewage pipe tunnel close to the home to repair a fault. Nine other members of the family were injured.

Name: Ahmad Raddad Ahmad Tanburah
Notes: Killed with his father and sister when their home was bombed after the father entered the sewage pipe tunnel close to the home to repair a fault. Nine other members of the family were injured.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Jum'ah al-'Attar
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative when there in a home under construction owned by the Abu Samrah family.

Name: Adam Ahmad Muhammad Khatab
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military branch operative when there in a home under construction owned by the Abu Samrah family.

Name: Yihya Mu'in Rushdi Abu Daqen
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Hamas while walking on the street in a-Nisr neighborhood.

Name: Yasin Ibrahim Yasin al-Baltaji
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Hamas while walking on the street in a-Nisr neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Tal'at Zaki al-Ghul
Notes: Killed while riding in his car near the Falastin stadium in a-Nisr neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Muhammad a-Luqah
Notes: Killed riding a motorbike in the al- Atatrah neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Khalil 'Omar al-Ma'suwabi
Notes: Injured in the a-Nisr neighborhood from missile fired at two operatives in the armed wing of Hamas who were passing by on a motorcycle and were killed in the strike.

Name: Badr a-Din Hashem 'Amer Abu Mani'
Notes: Killed together with another operative of the armed wing of Hamas while riding a motorcycle in the a-Nisr neighborhood. Another operative in the armed wing of Hamas who was walking on the street died of his wounds a month later.

Name: Yihya 'Omar Ibrahim Abu al-'Imrin
Notes: Killed together with another operative of the armed wing of Hamas while riding a motorcycle in the a-Nisr neighborhood. Another operative in the armed wing of Hamas who was walking on the street died of his wounds a month later.

Name: Muhammad Wael 'Abd a-Rahman al-Khudari
Notes: Killed on the porch of his home. At the entrance to the neighboring house, a one-year-old baby girl seated in a swing her home was killed.

Name: Zeinah Bilal Sabri Abu Taqiyah
Notes: Killed seated in a swing at the entrance to her home. A 16-year-old boy was killed on the porch of the neighboring house.

Name: Tasnim 'Issam Mustafa Judah
Notes: Killed with her mother, two brothers and a sister in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za tar neighborhood.

Name: Rawyah Ibrahim Muhammad Judah
Notes: Killed with two of her daughters and two of her sons in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za tar neighborhood.

Name: Ousamah 'Issam Mustafa Judah
Notes: Killed with his mother, a brother and two of sisters in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za tar neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad 'Issam Mustafa Judah
Notes: Killed with his mother, a brother and two sisters in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za tar neighborhood.

Name: Raghad 'Issam Mustafa Judah
Notes: Killed with her mother, two brothers and a sister in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za tar neighborhood.

Name: Mahmoud Ousamah Mahmoud Abu al-'Imrin
Notes: Killed while riding in his car in a-Nisr neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Saber Faraj al-'Ajleh
Notes: Intellectually disabled. Killed when he left his home in the a-Shuja'yah neighborhood.

Name: Nidal Soheil Hamdan Badawi
Notes: Injured walking on Sadam Hussein Street.

Name: Nisreen Ibrahim Isma'il Ahmad
Notes: Killed at home with her seven-year-old son, a twin, in the bombing of an adjacent four-story building that had been evacuated. Her seven-year-old daughter was injured. A young woman who had returned to the evacuated building to pick up an item was also killed.

Name: Hussein Khaled Hussein Ahmad
Notes: Killed at home with his mother in the bombing of an adjacent four-story building that had been evacuated. His twin sister was injured. A young woman who had returned to the evacuated building to pick up an item was also killed.

Name: Suhair 'Abd al-Karim Hamad Abu Madyan
Notes: Killed when she went to pick up an item from her apartment in a building that had been evacuated, and the building was then bombed. In an adjacent building, a mother and her seven-year-old son were killed, and the boy s twin sister injured.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Sa'ed Muhammad Shaluf
Notes: Killed on farmland in the a-Shokah area.

Name: Mahmoud Naser Mansur Qashlan
Notes: A guard on a farm, killed in his place of work. An operative in an armed wing of a Salafite organiztion was also killed in the strike.

Name: Yasin Hamed Jebril Abu Hamad
Notes: Killed on the a-Tawil family s farm. The guard on the farm was also killed.

Name: Musa Ahmad Qassem al-'Abadleh
Notes: Killed together with his father in his home. His brother was injured in the strike.

Name: Ahmad Qassem Musa al-'Abadleh
Notes: Injured at home with his two sons. He and one son died in hospital of their injuries.

Name: Isma'il Muslem Hamad Abu Bteihan
Notes: Killed while sitting under the shade of a tree opposite his home. Four hours later his home was bombarded and completely destroyed.

Name: Ibrahim Rashed Ahmad Barakah
Notes: Killed by his home in the al-Bruk neighborhood. Three other people were injured in the strike.

Name: Hayat 'Abd Rabo Suliman Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed while asleep at home, when the nearby homes of her brother and nephew were bombed. Her nephew, his wife and their two children were also killed in the bombing.

Name: Hadi Hayel Shehdeh Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed with his parents and brother when their home and that of his grandfather were bombed. His father s aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

Name: Hayel Shehdeh 'Abd Rabo Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed with his wife and two children when his home and that of his father were bombed. His aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

Name: Huda Muhammad Khamis Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed with her husband and two children when thier home and that of her father-in-law were bombed. Her husband s aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

Name: 'Abdallah Hayel Shehdeh Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed with his parents and brother when their home and that of his grandfather were bombed. His father s aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

Name: Muhammad Naser Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Injured by a missile that killed seven members of his family while they were on their farmland: five were children under the age of nine; two succumbed to their wounds several days after the incident. Since the injury he was hospitalized, lost the use of all four limbs and was on life support.

Name: 'Omar Naser Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Killed with four members of his family on their farmland. Two other family members succumbed to their wounds several days later. Five children under the age of nine were killed in the incident. Another member of the family, a nine-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs. He remained on life support at hospital after the injury, and died about four and a half years later.

Name: Ziad Tareq Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Injured by a missile that killed five members of his family while they were on their farmland. Two other members of his family were hit by the missile: one died of his injuries several days later; another, a 9-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs and was kept on life support in hospital, until he succumbed to his injuries some four and a half years later.

Name: Ahmad Tareq Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Killed with four members of his family on their farmland. Two other family members succumbed to their wounds several days later. Five children under the age of nine were killed in the incident. Another member of the family, a nine-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs. He remained on life support at hospital after the injury, and died about four and a half years later.

Name: Maram Tareq Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Killed with four members of her family on their farmland. Two other family members succumbed to their wounds several days later. Five children under the age of nine were killed in the incident. Another member of the family, a nine-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs. He remained on life support at hospital after the injury, and died about four and a half years later.

Name: Muhammad Ziad 'Abed a-Rifi
Notes: Killed with four members of his family on their farmland. Two other family members succumbed to their wounds several days later. Five children under the age of nine were killed in the incident. Another member of the family, a nine-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs. He remained on life support at hospital after the injury, and died about four and a half years later.

Name: 'Abdallah Tareq Ziad a-Rifi
Notes: Injured by a missile that killed five members of his family while they were on their farmland. Two other members of his family were hit by the missile: one died of his injuries several days later; another, a 9-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs and was kept on life support in hospital, until he succumbed to his injuries some four and a half years later.

Name: Naser Ziad 'Abed a-Rifi
Notes: Killed with four members of his family on their farmland. Two other family members succumbed to their wounds several days later. Five children under the age of nine were killed in the incident. Another member of the family, a nine-year-old boy, lost the use of all four limbs. He remained on life support at hospital after the injury, and died about four and a half years later.

Name: Srur Muhammad Jamil Tamburah
Notes: Killed together with his son while waiting for a taxi to take them to the market in Jabalya.

Name: Hassan Srur Muhammad Tamburah
Notes: Killed together with his father while waiting for a taxi to take them to the market in Jabalya.

Name: Marwan Muhammad Ibrahim Shaluf
Notes: Killed along with another person while they were riding a motorbike.

Name: Ibrahim 'Issam 'Eid Hammad
Notes: Killed along with another person while they were riding a motorbike.

Name: 'Issam Muhammad Mahmoud al-Husni
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Hamas while driving on a-Nisr Street in the a-Radwan neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad A'bbas
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Hamas while driving on a-Nisr Street in the a-Radwan neighborhood.

Name: Jum'ah Ibrahim Salem Matar
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad near the a-Nuseirat towers.

Name: 'Omar Taysir Ibrahim Abu Nada
Notes: Killed together with another operative in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad near the a-Nuseirat towers.

Name: Husam 'Abd Rabo Muhammad Abu Jaser
Notes: Killed while he was working on his farmland.

Name: Rami Hamdi 'Abd a-Rahman Salem
Notes: Killed with his brother and three other people, two of them operatives in an armed wing, at a cemetary.

Name: Muhammad Hamdi 'Abd a-Rahman Salem
Notes: Killed with his brother and three other people, two of them operatives in an armed wing, at a cemetary.

Name: Awsam Talal Sham'ah Tafesh
Notes: Killed together with four other people, two of them operatives in armed wings, at a cemetary.

Name: Salem Isma'il Salamah Abu Ghadayin
Notes: Killed together with four other people, one ofthem an operative in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad, at a cemetary.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahim Talal Hassan a-Shweikh
Notes: Killed together with four other people, one ofthem an operative in the armed wing of Fatah, at a cemetary.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Salem Muhammad Abu Hadayed
Notes: Injured when he and his brother, an Islamic Jihad military branch operative, were riding on a motorcycle on Salah a-Din Street. His brother was killed.

Name: Hamdan Salem Muhammad Abu Hadayed
Notes: Killed when he and his brother, a Popular Front military branch operative, were riding on a motorcycle on Salah a-Din Street. His brother was injured and later died of his wounds.

Name: Bashir Ahmad Muhammad Abu Shreiteh
Notes: Killed together with his nephew while they were filling water from a container in the yard of their home.

Name: Mahmoud Tal'at Ahmad Abu Shreiteh
Notes: Killed together with his uncle while they were filling water from a container in the yard of their home.

Name: Yusef Naser Hussein Kulab
Notes: Killed with his mother, two brothers, and three Hamas military branch operatives when his home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Siba Rami Hassan Yunes
Notes: Killed at home with her grandmother and grandfather in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. A member of the  Aytah family, a woman, was killed in a nearby home. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Hassan Hussein I'bayyan Yunes
Notes: Killed at home with his wife and granddaughter in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. A member of the  Aytah family, a woman, was killed in a nearby home. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Amal Ibrahim Ahmad Yunes
Notes: Killed at home with her husband and granddaughter in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. A member of the  Aytah family, a woman, was killed in a nearby home. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: 'Abd al-Fatah Hussein al-'Abed Abu Salimah
Notes: Injured in his home in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well.

Name: 'Abdallah Naser Hussein Kulab
Notes: Killed with his mother, two brothers, and three Hamas military branch operatives when his home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Ahmad Naser Hussein Kulab
Notes: Killed with his mother, two brothers, and three Hamas military branch operatives when his home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Nazirah Ramadan Isma'il Kulab
Notes: Killed with three of her sons and three Hamas military branch operatives when her home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: 'Aishah Isma'il Hassan 'Atiyyah
Notes: Killed at home in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. In a nearby home, three members of the Yunes family were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Muhammad Hamdan Muhammad Barhum
Notes: Killed in the Kulab family home along with two other Hamas military branch operatives. Also killed were four members of the Kulab family. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Raed Subhi Ahmad al-'Attar
Notes: Killed in the Kulab family home along with two other Hamas military branch operatives. Also killed were four members of the Kulab family. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Salah Abu Shamaleh
Notes: Killed in the Kulab family home along with two other Hamas military branch operatives. Also killed were four members of the Kulab family. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the  Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Mustafa Sufian Darwish Muheisen
Notes: Killed together with his father while they were working on their farmland.

Name: Sufian Darwish Muhammad Muheisen
Notes: Killed together with his son while they were working on their farmland.

Name: Zaki Suliman Hassan a-Ra'i
Notes: Killed together with another man and a three-year-old girl while they were sitting by their home, after a missile was fired at a horse-drawn cart parked nearby.

Name: Hani Muhammad Hashem Yasin
Notes: Killed together with another man and a three-year-old girl while they were sitting by their home, after a missile was fired at a horse-drawn cart parked nearby.

Name: Nur Mahmoud 'Abd al-Basset Abu Hasireh
Notes: Killed together with two other people while they were sitting by their home, after a missile was fired at a horse-drawn cart parked nearby.

Name: Mahmoud 'Abd al-'Aziz Muhammad al-Bura'i
Notes: Killed in the north of a-Nisr neighborhood.

Name: Saher Muhammad Haydar al-'Abet
Notes: Killed with his cousin while they were walking with other relatives on Salah a-Din Street, returning to the homes they had fled previously fled.

Name: Muhammad 'Imad Haydar al-'Abet
Notes: Killed with his cousin while they were walking with other relatives on Salah a-Din Street, returning to the homes they had fled previously fled.

Name: Nabilah 'Eid Salamah a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with her husband and three children. She was nine months pregnant. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. In the neighboring home two of his brothers were killed. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Muhammad Mustafa Mahmoud a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with one of his brothers when the families  homes were bombed. In the neighboring home, another brother, his three children and nine-months-pregnant wife were also killed. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Nabilah's son Raafat Mustafa a-Loh
Notes: A day-old infant. He was delivered by C-section after his mother was killed in the bombing of their home. His father, sister and two brothers were also killed. Two of his uncles were killed in his grandfather s home. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Mustafa Raafat Mustafa a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with his parents, brother and sister. His mother was nine months pregnant; after she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. Two of his uncles were killed in his grandfather s home. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Meyasar Raafat Mustafa a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with his parents, brother and sister. His mother was nine-months pregnant; after she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. Two of his uncles were killed in his grandfather s home. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Ahmad Mustafa Mahmoud a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with one of his brothers when the families  homes were bombed. In the neighboring home, another brother, his three children and nine-months-pregnant wife were also killed. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Iman Yunes Qassem a-Loh
Notes: Injured in the bombing of two nearby homes of relatives, which killed seven people. An infant, delivered by C-section after his mother was killed in one of the homes bombed, died later that day.

Name: Raafat Mustafa Mahmoud a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with his nine-months-pregnant wife and their three children. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. In the neighboring home two of his brothers were killed. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Farah Raafat Mustafa a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with her parents and two brothers. Her mother was nine months pregnant; after she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. Two of her uncles were killed in her grandfather s home. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Widad Mustafa Harb a-Deif
Notes: Wife of Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch. Killed with her two-year-old daughter and seven-month-old baby boy in their home the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Three neighbors, members of the a-Dalu family, one of them a minor and another a Hamas military branch operative, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Sarah Muhammad Diab a-Deif
Notes: A toddler. The daughter of Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch. Killed with her mother and seven-month-old brother in their home the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Three neighbors, members of the a-Dalu family, one of them a minor and another a Hamas military branch operative, were also killed in the strike.

Name: 'Ali Muhammad Diab a-Deif
Notes: seven-month-old infant. The infant son of Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch. Killed with his mother and two-year-old sister, in their home the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Three neighbors, members of the a-Dalu family, one of them a minor and another a Hamas military branch operative, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Mustafa Rabah Shihtah a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with his mother and brother, a Hamas military branch operative, in their apartment in a building in the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch, also lived in that building. A-Deif s wife and their two children, a two-year-old girl and a seven-month old baby boy, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Wafa Hussein Ahmad a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with her two sons, one of them a minor and the other a Hamas military branch operative, in their apartment in a building in the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Muhammad A-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch, also lived in that building. A-Deif s wife and their two children, a two-year-old girl and a seven-month old baby boy, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Ahmad Rabah Shihtah a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with his mother and brother (a minor) in their apartment in a building in the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Muhammad A-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch, also lived in that building. A-Deif s wife and their two children, a two-year-old girl and a seven-month old baby boy, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Ibrahim Isma'il Ibrahim Abu 'Odeh
Notes: Killed while on his way home in the al-Burah area.

Name: Nariman Khalil Suliman al-Bshiti

Name: Khadrah 'Awwad Salam Abu Teilakh

Name: Khalaf 'Atiyyah 'Odeh Abu Sneimah

Notes: Killed together with his brother while they were traveling in a cart drawn by a donkey to evacuate the bodies of their two sisters who were killed in the area earlier.

Name: Rasmiya Muhammad Yusef Salamah

Name: Mus'ab Saleh 'Odeh Salamah

Name: Muhammad Khaled Muhammad Ahel

Name: Muhammad Naser Khaled Harun
Notes: Killed in his home after it was bombed.

Name: Muhammad Majed Sa'di Abu Kamil
Notes: Killed in the military s incursion into the area of Juhor a-Dik. He was there with other Hamas military branch operatives.

Name: Hassan Sha'ban Hassan al-Khamisi

Name: Hamadah Rafiq Hamdan 'Aleiwa
Notes: Killed in the a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Soheil Jilo Shehdeh Jilo

Name: Suha Na'im Muhammad Ekhrawat

Name: Muna Rami 'Adel Ekhrawat
Notes: Killed together with her mother, who was at an advanced stage of pregnancy. Her baby brother was born by Caesarian section in hospital and died two hours later. Three other members of her family were injured in the incident.

Name: Ahmad Rami 'Adel Ekhrawat

Name: Naji Jamal Muhammad al-Fajam

Name: Hamzah Ziad Suliman Abu 'Anza
Notes: Killed together with another person while they were standing with others close to Khalil a-Rahman Mosque.

Name: Hakmeh Nafe'a Silmi Abu 'Adwan
Notes: Killed together with her sister close to their home.

Name: Najah Nafe'a Silmi Abu 'Adwan
Notes: Killed together with her sister on the street close to their home.

Name: Walid Suliman Salem Abu Dhaher
Notes: Killed in exchanges of gunfire with soldiers.

Name: Mahmoud Suliman Mahmoud Abu Sabhah
Notes: Killed when his home collapsed. Others were injured in the incident.

Name: Salwa 'Abd al-'Aziz Ahmad al-Munifi

Name: Samira Sanad Muhammad al-Munifi

Name: Hassan Khader Hassan Baker
Notes: Killed in his home. Another person was injured close to the home and died of his injuries some seven days later.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Sa'ed Baker
Notes: Killed close to the home of Hassan Baker, who was also killed.

Name: Ahmad 'Issam 'Atiyyah Wishah

Name: Khalil Naser 'Atiyyah Wishah

Name: Wael Muhammad 'Abd al-Jalil Ramadan

Name: Ahmad Muhammad 'Abd al-Jalil Ramadan
Notes: Killed together with his brother, an operative in the armed wing of Hamas, when they were walking in the "Block 2" area of the refugee camp. Two other people were hit in the strike, one of whom died instantly while the other died two days later of his injuries.

Name: 'Abd a-Naser Sa'di 'Abd al-Khaleq Musleh

Name: Ahmad Salah Muhammad Abu Sidu

Name: Mahmoud Raed Mahmoud al-'Esh

Name: Mu'tasem Salim Salamah al-Haj Salamah

Name: 'Abdallah Muhammad Hamed a-S'adi

Name: Yusef Fawzi Ibrahim Abu Mustafa

Name: 'Adel Muhammad Hweishel Abu Hweishel

Name: 'Obaydah Fadel Muhammad Abu Hweishel

Name: Yusef Ibrahim 'Ayesh a-Ramahi

Name: Iman Ibrahim 'Ayesh a-Ramahi
Notes: Killed with his her brother and sister in a farming shed where his family fled to get away from the Israeli border.

Name: Ibtehal Ibrahim 'Ayesh a-Ramahi

Name: Ibrahim Subhi Yusef al-Feiri
Notes: Killed in his parents' home.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim Subhi Shbeir

Name: Wisam 'Alaa Adib a-Najar

Name: Ahmad 'Abdallah Muhammad Abu Salah

Name: Ahmad Amin Muhammad Abu Hasireh

Name: Muhammad Radi Mahmoud Abu Raidah

Name: Shamah 'Imad 'Alian Abu Raidah

Name: Layla A'bbas Isma'il al-Wahidi

Name: Shahd Mu'in 'Ali Qishtah

Name: Ahmad As'ad Rashad al-Baddi

Name: Muhammad Ahmad As'ad al-Baddi

Name: Nur al-Islam Raed Ahmad Abu Hweishel

Name: Hani 'Awad 'Odeh Samur

Name: Yusef Ahmad Muhammad a-Zamli

Name: Fadi Bashir 'Abdallah al-'Abadleh

Name: 'Arafah Sultan Muhammad M'aruf

Name: 'Abd al-Qader Khaled Yusef al-Harazin

Name: Ahmad Fawzi Hamad Radwan
Notes: Injured by a missile together with his brother, also a Fatah military branch operative in the Ayman Juda Brigade, on a street in the neighborhood of a-Zannah, as they and others were trying to rescue two members of the Radwan family who had been injured by a missile fired shortly before. One of the wounded was a Hamas military branch operative. All four died of their injuries after EMT crews were unable to reach them.

Name: Mahmoud Fawzi Hamad Radwan
Notes: Injured by a missile together with his brother, also a Fatah military branch operative in the Ayman Juda Brigade, on a street in the neighborhood of a-Zannah, as they and others were trying to rescue two members of the Radwan family who had been injured by a missile fired shortly before. One of the wounded was a Hamas military branch operative. All four died of their injuries after EMT crews were unable to reach them.

Name: Bilal Muhammad Mahmoud Radwan
