Two brothers of the Radwan family, both Fatah military branch operatives in the Ayman Juda Brigade, were injured by a missile as they, together with others, were trying to rescue the two cousins. All four died of their injuries after EMT crews were unable to reach them.

Name: Munzer Nabil Mahmoud Radwan

Two brothers of the Radwan family, both Fatah military branch operatives in the Ayman Juda Brigade, were injured by a missile as they, together with others, were trying to rescue the two cousins. All four died of their injuries after EMT crews were unable to reach them.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd Rabo Yusef Bader

Name: Yihya Akram Muhammad M'aruf
Notes: Killed while walking in al-'Atatrah neighbourhood , Beit Lahya.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Rizeq 'Ashur
Notes: Killed while playing with other childen in an olive grove belonging to his family.

Name: Yihya Muhammad Yihya 'Awad

Name: Saqer Yusef Khalil Bulbul

Name: Tareq 'Awni Mustafa Hajilah
Notes: Killed on the street in a-Shujayah, Gaza City, when the a-Shawa family's house was bombed, shortly after passage of a calvacade of Arab foreign ministers and the Turkish foreign minister. Three other civilians were also killed.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Hussein a-Zuhri
Notes: Killed on the street in a-Shujayah, Gaza City, in the bombing of the a-Shawa family's house, shortly after the passage of a cavalcade of Arab foreign ministers and the Turkish foreign minister. Three other civilians were also killed.

Name: Yusra Basel Murtada a-Shawa

Notes: Killed while hunting birds about 400 meters from the perimeter fence, together with a friend, who was also killed.

Name: Mahmoud Khalil Mahmoud al-'Arja
Notes: Killed while hunting birds about 400 meters from the perimeter fence, together with a friend, who was also killed.

Name: Muhammad Fouad Khalil Hijazi
Notes: Killed when his house was bombed. His father and brother were also killed.

Name: Ahmad Tawfiq Mamduh a-Nesasreh
Notes: Killed in a bombing that destroyed his house in Rafah; one of his brothers was also killed

Name: Jomanah Salamah Ibrahim Ise'ifan
Notes: Killed in his sleep while at home with other family members. His sister was also killed.

Name: Ahmad Mahmoud Ahmad Abu 'Amrah

Name: Matar 'Imad 'Abd a-Rahman Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Wounded and killed with two other people, one of them armed, as they went on foot to aid young people injured by shooting a few minutes earlier while playing soccer. Among the young people injured by the earlier firing, two died. A short time before the youths came under fire, armed Palestinians had fired an anti-tank missile at a military reconnaissance jeep near the perimeter fence.

Name: Ahmad Mustafa Khaled Hararah
Notes: Killed while playing soccer with other youths. Two were wounded and killed on the spot and a few minutes later, more tank shells were fired, killing two other people at the scene. One other person at the scene who was a participant in hostilities was also wounded and died of his injuries three days later. A short time earlier, armed Palestinians fired an anti-tank missile at a military reconnaissance jeep near the perimeter fence.

Name: Ahmad Kamel Muhammad a-Dardasawi
Notes: Wounded and killed with two other people, one of them armed, as they went on foot to aid young people injured by shooting a few minutes earlier while playing soccer. Among the young people injured by the earlier firing, two died. A short time before the youths came under fire, armed Palestinians had fired an anti-tank missile at a military reconnaissance jeep near the perimeter fence.

Name: Muhammad Ousamah Hassan Hararah
Notes: Killed while playing soccer with other youths. Two were wounded and killed on the spot and a few minutes later, more tank shells were fired, killing two other people at the scene. One other person at the scene who was a participant in hostilities was also wounded and died of his injuries three days later. A short time earlier, armed Palestinians fired an anti-tank missile at a military reconnaissance jeep near the perimeter fence.

Name: Muhammad Ziad 'Abdallah Qanu'
Notes: Wounded and killed with two other people as they went on foot to aid young people injured by shooting a few minutes earlier while playing soccer. Among the young people injured by the earlier firing, two died. A short time before the youths came under fire, armed Palestinians had fired an anti-tank missile at a military reconnaisance jeep near the perimeter fence.

Name: Yusef Muhammad Ibrahim Abu Jalhum
Notes: Wounded while firing rockets at Israel together with other armed persons, one of whom was also killed. He died of his wounds the following day.

Name: Zakaria Mamduh 'Omar al-Jamal
Notes: Killed while trying to launch missiles at Israel together with other armed persons of whom two were also killed

Name: Khalil Faraj Muhammad al-Jarbeh
Notes: Killed while trying to launch missiles at Israel together with other armed persons of whom two were also killed

Name: 'Eid 'Okal Muhammad Hijazi
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle with another armed person

Notes: He was killed as he placed an explosive charge next to the perimeter fence east of al-Bureij refugee camp.

Name: Marwan Faraj Muhammad al-Jarbeh
Notes: He was killed as he placed an explosive charge next to the perimeter fence east of al-Bureij refugee camp.

Name: Jihad 'Ata Suliman a-Daghameh
Notes: Killed during an exchange of gunfire with soldiers east of Khan Yunis.

Name: Suliman 'Abd al-Hakim 'Aref 'Arafat
Notes: Killed during an exchange of gunfire with soldiers east of Khan Yunis.

Name: Haitham 'Abd al-Hakim 'Aref 'Arafat
Notes: Killed by a shell while looking for his brother, who had been killed a few hours earlier in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers east of Khan Yunis.

Name: Muhammad Ashraf 'Abd Rabo Ghaben
Notes: He was killed by tank shelling while trying, with a group of armed men, to lay an explosive charge next to the perimeter fence.

Name: Fares Akram Ahmad Jaber
Notes: Active in the military wing of Fatah, he was killed by missile fire while with a group of armed men.

Name: Hassan Ibrahim 'Abd a-Rahim al-Qatrawi
Notes: Killed while on his way with other armed men to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: 'Awad Muhammad 'Awad Abu Nseir
Notes: Killed while on his way with other armed men to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: Huzaifah Muhammad Subhi al-Hams
Notes: Killed while on his way with other armed men to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: Mubarak Ruba'a Rabi' Abu Shaluf
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel.

Name: 'Udai Muhammad Sabah Abu Hish
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel.

Name: Naser Jum'ah 'Eid a-Tarabin
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel.

Name: Jihad 'Abd a-Rahim Ahmad a-Smeiri
Notes: Killed while moving around with other armed men.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Difallah 'Abd a-Ghafur
Notes: Killed while moving around with other armed men.

Name: Hani Salem Muhammad Abu Ghazal
Notes: Killed while trying to sneak into Israel to look for work.

Name: Mahmoud Jum'ah Ibrahim a-Sharathah
Notes: Killed while trying to sneak into Israel to look for work.

Name: Bashir Suliman Musa Abu Duheil
Notes: Killed while trying to sneak into Israel to look for work.

Name: Mustafa Muhammad Saber Wadi
Notes: Killed by soldiers' gunfire while he and his friends were 300 meters west of the eastern border of the Gaza Strip. Another youth was wounded and taken for treatment to Barzilai Hospital (in Israel).

Name: Rizeq Muhammad Ibrahim al-Masri
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel next to the Egyptian border.

Name: Naser Yusef Muhammad al-Ja'ran (Abu Seif)
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel adjacent to the Egyptian border.

Name: Kamel Khaled Sha'ban a-Dahduh
Notes: Killed when he and other armed men fired rockets at Israel.

Name: Mahmoud Musa Ramadan al-Bana
Notes: Killed when he and other armed men fired rockets at Israel.

Name: Muhammad Salem Birawi Marshud
Notes: Killed when he and other armed men fired rockets at Israel.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Muhammad Nuseir
Notes: Killed after he and 'Abd al-Hafez a-Silawi placed an explosive charge.

Name: 'Abd al-Hafez Khalil Musa a-Silawi
Notes: Killed after he and Mahmud Nuseir placed an explosive charge.

Name: Ghazi Maher Ghazi a-Z'anin
Notes: Killed while in an agricultural area with friends and family.

Name: Mansur 'Ali Muhammad al-Batnijy
Notes: Killed while working in tunnels.

Name: Nael 'Ali Muhammad al-Batnijy
Notes: Killed while working in tunnels.

Name: Ibrahim 'Ali Muhammad al-Batnijy
Notes: An activist in the military wing of Hamas, he was killed while working in tunnels.

Name: Sa'id 'Ata Muhammad al-Hassumi
Notes: Killed while with his brother and friend, who was severely wounded, close to the perimeter fence.

Name: Ahmad Zuheir Mahmoud a-Sumari
Notes: Mentally disabled, he was killed when he approached Nahal Oz.

Name: Hiyam Salim 'Abd al-'Aziz Abu 'Aish
Notes: Killed while at home, which was about 1300 meters from the perimeter fence, while armed men were approaching the border.

Name: Taher 'Issa Muhammad 'Issa
Notes: Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near east of Gaza city.

Name: Hani Muhammad Salem a-Tarabin
Notes: Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near east of Gaza city.

Name: Fahed Muhammad al-Minawi
Notes: Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near east of Gaza city.

Name: 'Abd al-Majid Sa'id Musa Saleh
Notes: Killed while he and Yassin Jasser tried to place a bomb next to the border, after soldiers at the Kerem Shalom crossing noticed them and shot them.

Name: Yasin Salim Yasin Jasser
Notes: Killed while he and 'Abd al-Majed Saleh tried to place a bomb next to the border, after soldiers at the Kerem Shalom crossing noticed them and shot them.

Name: Hamdan Fa'iq Muhammad al-Astal
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel.

Name: Jihad Khalil Muhammad Abu Jaradah
Notes: Killed while working in a tunnel.

Name: Jamil Muhammad 'Aref Qafah
Notes: Killed while he and Muhammad al-Hamida tried to place an explosive charge about 120 meters from the eastern border with Israel.

Name: Muhammad Na'im Muhammad al-Hamaydah
Notes: Killed while he and Jamal Qafa tried to place an explosive charge about 120 meters from the eastern border with Israel.

Name: 'Ali Muhammad Mahmoud Abu Ful
Notes: Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near the Israeli border.

Name: 'Abdallah Mahmoud Salem Isbetan
Notes: Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near the Israeli border.

Name: Mahmoud Sami Hassan Fatuh
Notes: An activist in the military wing of Islamic Jihad, he was killed while riding in a car after firing rockets at Israel.

Name: Mahmoud al-'Abed Saleh Hammad
Notes: Killed while at an observation point with other armed men east of al-Maghazi refugee camp.

Name: Ibrahim Hassan Dawood Bamba
Notes: Killed while at an observation point with other armed men east of al-Maghazi refugee camp.

Name: Wasim Hassan Hussein Mansur
Notes: Killed while at an observation point with other armed men east of al-Maghazi refugee camp.

Name: Khaled Harb Khaled Sh'alan
Notes: Killed while riding in his car.

Name: Hammad Barrak Salem Salimeh
Notes: Killed while gracing his flock 300 metes from the perimeter fence.

Name: 'Ali 'Abd al-Bari Ibrahim al-Qadrah
Notes: He was killed while riding on a motor scooter.

Name: Khaled Rafiq Diab al-Kafarneh
Notes: Killed during an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near the perimeter fence.

Name: Miqbal Yusef Muhammad Abu 'Odeh
Notes: Killed, while wearing an explosive belt, following an exchange of gunfire with soldiers near the perimeter fence.

Name: Fouad Riyad Faiz Hamdan
Notes: Killed while trying to place an explosive charge next to the Israeli border.

Name: Ayman Shihadah Muhammad Abu Jazar
Notes: Killed while he was driving in a car with two other armed men, who were wounded. They apparently had previously fired rockets at Israel.

Name: Hussein Faiz Hussein Shameyah
Notes: Killed while riding on a motor scooter in al-'Aqad area.

Name: Na'im 'Aref Ishteiwi
Notes: Fragments of a missile were found on his body.

Name: Angham Raafat 'Atallah al-Masri
Notes: Killed while she was on the street with other persons.

Name: Intesar Farid Suliman al-Masri
Notes: Killed when she returned to see the condition of her house, which was situated close to the border.

Name: Jihan Sami Sa'di al-Hilu
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Maher 'Abd al-'Azim Yusef Abu Rjeileh
Notes: Shot after the cease-fire while he and his family were on their way to the family's plot of land. He was about 400 meters from the border with Israel when he was shot.

Name: Ibrahim Ahmad 'Abdallah 'Alwan
Notes: Killed in a gunfire exchange with soldiers.

Name: Ibrahim Saber Rabi' Jneid
Notes: Killed in a gunfire exchange with soldiers.

Name: Ghanimah Ma'sud Nimer Abu Halimah
Notes: A disabled person, she remained at home when her family transferred to the UNRWA-school compound as she was unable to walk and Red Cross personnel were unable to get to the house to take her.

Name: 'Abed Jum'ah Mahmoud 'Ayad
Notes: Shot with his wife by soldiers while they were fleeing from their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Mahdiyeah Suliman Muhammad 'Ayad
Notes: Shot with her husband by soldiers while they were fleeing from their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Fatimah 'Awad Khalil Ghaben
Notes: Killed while on her way home.

Name: Sabrin Muhammad Subhi Abu Samahah
Notes: Her body was found under the ruins of her house.

Name: Maryam Mutawe'a Nasrallah Mutawe'aen
Notes: Her body was found under the ruins of her house, which had been shelled and then demolished by bulldozers.

Name: Ibrahim Muhammad Kassab Shurab
Notes: Killed in a car while riding with his father and brothers during a cease fire when soldiers shot at them, striking the father, who was driving, causing him to crash into a wall. Soldiers ordered them to get out of the car and when they did so, fired at them. The brother Kasab was killed by a shot in the stomach, and Ibrahim was shot in the legs and bled to death until midnight, while soldiers stood by.

Name: Kassab Muhammad Kassab Shurab
Notes: Killed in a car when riding with his father and brothers during a cease-fire when soldiers shot at them, striking the father, who was driving, causing him to crash into a wall. Soldiers ordered them to get out of the car and when they did so, fired at them. Kasab was killed by a shot to the stomach. His brother Ibrahim was shot in the legs and bled to death until midnight, while soldiers stood by.

Name: Raafat Khalil Hamdan Abu al-'Alla
Notes: Killed while riding on a moped near his house.

Name: Khamis Nimer 'Abd a-Latif Zaghrah
Notes: Killed in a-Tawam neighborhood.

Name: Sundus Sa'id Hassan Abu Sultan
Notes: Killed by shrapnel that struck her in the head while she was next to her house.

Name: Rami Nahed Mahmoud Abu 'Obeid
Notes: Killed in the Mukhbarat Towers, in a-Sudaniyah neighborhood.

Name: Mus'ab Muhammad 'Ali Abu al-'Imrin
Notes: Killed in the Sheikh Radwan neighborhood.

Name: Munir Sami Amin Shuheibar
Notes: Killed when a building adjacent to his house was bombed.

Name: Ahmad Fawaz Ahmad Saleh
Notes: Killed while at home with his family.

Name: Fawzeyeh Fawaz Ahmad Saleh
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Anwaar Marwan Fa'iq Shihadah
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Bilal Muhammad Shehdeh al-Ashqar
Notes: Killed with his brother in the bombing of the UNRWA school in Beit Lahiya, where the family had gone for refuge after escaping from their home. The mother was wounded in her head and in her right hand, which was subsequently amputated.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Shehdeh al-Ashqar
Notes: Killed with his brother in the bombing of the UNRWA school in Beit Lahiya, where the family had gone for refuge. The mother was wounded in the head and right hand, which was subsequently amputated.

Name: Fatimah Mahmoud 'Obeid 'Abdallah
Notes: Killed while at home in the 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo neighborhood.

Name: Fathi Muhammad 'Abdallah 'Obeid
Notes: Killed at home in the 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Saleh Sa'id Abu Diyah
Notes: Killed while on his way home.

Name: Na'im Muhammad 'Abed Shihadah
Notes: Killed while paying a condolence visit to the family of a relative who had been killed.

Name: Khaled Hafez Khaled a-Turk
Notes: An operative in the military wing of Hamas, he was killed in Mashru' 'Amer, close to Mu'az Ben Jabal Mosque.

Name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Salamah Abu 'Ateiwi
Notes: Killed while standing in front of his house by firing from the Mughraqa area, which lies in the northern section of the refugee camp.

Name: Muhammad Mahmoud Muhammad Jarbo'a
Notes: A fisherman, he was killed from fire directed at fishermen sailing in boats off the Gaza shore.

Name: Faiz Sa'id Faraj Shmali
Notes: Killed by a missile that was fired landed close to his house.

Name: Ashraf Ribhi al-'Abed Baner
Notes: A member of the military wing of the Popular Front, he was killed in a condolence tent in a-Saja'iyah neighborhood after firing rockets at Israel. Other armed men were active in the area.

Name: Faiz 'Ali al-'Abed Baner
Notes: Killed while in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

Name: 'Abed 'Ali 'Abed Baner
Notes: Killed while in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood .

Name: Shadi al-'Abed 'Ali Baner
Notes: Killed while he was in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed men were active in the area.

Name: Muhammad Yasser Mansur al-Qaram
Notes: A member of the military wing of Islamic Jihad, he was killed while he was in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed men were active in the area.

Name: 'Alaa Sa'id Khamis Muwaded
Notes: Killed in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

Name: Subhi Muhammad Khamis Muwaded
Notes: Killed in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

Name: Mus'ab Subhi Muhammad Muwaded
Notes: Killed in a condolences tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

Name: Ahmad 'Abed 'Ali Baner
Notes: Killed while in a condolence tent for his brother in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

Name: Aya 'Iz a-Din Muhammad Abu al-'Eish
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo.

Name: Mayar 'Iz a-Din Muhammad Abu al-'Eish
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo.

Name: Nur Sh'hab a-Din Muhammad Abu al-'Eish
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo.

Name: Bisan 'Iz a-Din Muhammad Abu al-'Eish
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo.

Name: Nassar 'Abd al-Mahdi Nassar Mutawe'a
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Anwar Salah Ibrahim Abu Teilakh
Notes: Killed after he remained at home to look after the sheep while his family fled to the UN school.

Name: 'Atiyyah Talab 'Abd Rabo Abu al-Hasir
Notes: Killed after he remained at home to look after the sheep while his family fled to the UN school.

Name: Zakiyyeh 'Abd al-Hai 'Ali Abu 'Aytah
Notes: Killed while in front of her house with three members of her family.

Name: Anwar Salman Rushdi Abu 'Aytah
Notes: Killed while in front of his house with three members of his family.

Name: Malak Salamah 'Abd al-Hai Abu 'Aytah
Notes: Killed while in front of her house with three members of her family.

Name: Ahmad Salamah 'Abd al-Hai Abu 'Aytah
Notes: Killed while in front of his house with three members of his family.

Name: Rawan Isma'il Muhammad a-Najar
Notes: Killed on the street next to her house.

Name: 'Omar Mahmoud Ramadan al-Marnakh
Notes: Killed as he left his house to aid other armed operatives.

Name: Mahmoud Khader 'Abed Bahar
Notes: Killed in Mashru' 'Amer.

Name: Ahmad Mansur Hussni Hasunah
Notes: Killed while trying to aid a child who was wounded while playing in a field in a-Sharafa area in a-Tufah neighborhood. His name is mentioned on a list of combatants, but B'Tselem's investigation rejected this contention.

Name: 'Ali Kamal Badawi al-Barawi
Notes: Killed while playing in a field in a-Sharafa area in a-Tufah neighborhood. His brother and friend came to help him, and then another missile was fired, killing his friend, Ahmad Mansur Hosni Hasuneh. His brother was wounded and taken to Egypt for treatment.

Name: 'Ali Kamal Badawi Khader
Notes: Killed while at home in a-Tufah neighborhood.

Name: Hamuda Zayed Ahmad Thabet
Notes: Killed in a-Nasser neighborhood.

Name: 'Abdallah Muhammad 'Abed al-Juju
Notes: Killed at home in Tel al-Hawa neighborhood.

Name: 'Issa Muhammad 'Aiyadah Irmeilat
Notes: Killed while collecting wood with his friends.

Name: Fadi Hassan Khader Hasanein
Notes: Killed next to Security and Defense Headquarters.

Name: Muhammad Ousamah 'Abd al-Fatah 'Aqilan
Notes: Killed in the "Ard 'Annan" area.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Haitham Judah Zamlat
Notes: Killed in al-Karameh Towers, in the northern part of the city.

Name: Manal Hassan 'Ali al-Batran
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing her husband.

Name: Bilal 'Issa 'Abd al-Hadi al-Batran
Notes: Killed when his house was bombed, apparently to kill his father.

Name: Islam 'Issa 'Abd al-Hadi al-Batran
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing her father.

Name: 'Iz a-Din 'Issa 'Abd al-Hadi al-Batran
Notes: Killed when his house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing his father.

Name: Iman 'Issa 'Abd al-Hadi al-Batran
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing her father.

Name: Ihssan 'Issa 'Abd al-Hadi al-Batran
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing her father.

Name: Husam Muhammad 'Ali Abu Daqah
Notes: Killed in the al-Fukhari area while driving home on a moped after working his land.

Name: Muhannad 'Amer Khalil al-Jdeily
Notes: Killed while at his home.

Name: Hashem Rabah Muhyi a-Din al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with Nasser a-Sifi, when they were in their car and passed by a cemetery from which rockets were fired.

Name: Naser Yusef 'Abd al-Hadi a-Sifi
Notes: Killed along with Hashem al-Hatu when they were in their car and passed by a cemetery from which rockets were fired.

Name: Mahmoud Hussein Muhammad Matar
Notes: Mentally disabled, he left his house and went missing for two days. After the soldiers left the area, his brother found his body next to al-'Amudi intersection, in the northern part of the city. He had been shot in the thigh and apparently bled for two days, during which nobody was able to come to his aid.

Name: Muhammad Nabil Sha'ban Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Iyad Mahmoud Sha'ban Siyam
Notes: Brother of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Sa'id Muhammad Sha'ban Siyam
Notes: A minister in the Hamas government in Gaza, he was killed when the army bombed his house. B'Tselem does not have sufficient information to determine which function he carried out in hostilities against Israel.

Name: Samah 'Atiyyah Muhammad Siyam
Notes: Sister-in-law of Sa'id Siyam, she was killed with her husband in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Muhammad Sa'id Muhammad Siyam
Notes: A policeman and son of Sa'id Siyam, he was killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Iman 'Abd al-Qader Jebril Islim
Notes: Killed in the bombing of the house of Sa'id Siyam.

Name: Muhammad Isma'il Mahmoud Siyam
Notes: Bodyguard of Sa'id Siyam, he was killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Muhammad Sha'ban Ahmad Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Was injured in the bombing of Siyam's house, and died of his woundes three years later.

Name: Sahar 'Ali Sha'ban Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: 'Abdallah Nabil Sha'ban Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Husam Muhammad Sha'ban Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Sha'ban Islim
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Ahmad Ousamah Muhammad Qurtom
Notes: Neighbor of Sa'id Siyam. Killed in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Amal 'Ayad 'Odeh Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her mother-in-law and her three children when they came to check their house, which had been bombed.

Name: Arij 'Ata Hassan Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her mother, brother and sister, and grandmother while on their way to their bombed house.

Name: Sabrin 'Ata Hassan Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her mother, two sisters, and grandmother when they came to check their house that had been bombed.

Name: Baraa 'Ata Hassan Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with his mother, brother, sister, and grandmother when they went to check their house, which had been bombed.

Name: 'Aishah 'Ayad 'Eid Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her daughter-in-law and her three grandchildren when they came to check their house that had been bombed.

Name: Rasmi Muhammad 'Ali Abu Jarir
Notes: Was driving with Mustafa Barakeh to get fuel from Rafah when a tank opened fire on them, wounding them. They called Barakeh's brother, but both were dead by the time he arrived.

Name: Mustafa Kamel Ahmad Barakah
Notes: While on the way to Rafah with Rasmi Abu Jarir to get fuel, a tank opened fire on them, wounding both of them. He phoned his brother, but they were dead by the time he arrived.

Name: Maher Khaled Ja'far al-Beik
Notes: Killed while next to the Islamic compound in Gaza. Armed persons were present in the area.

Name: Ahmad Fouad Muhammad Thabet
Notes: Killed while riding on a moped to buy provisions.

Name: Bilal Taysir Taha Musa
Notes: Killed when moving about with other armed men.

Name: Naser 'Abd al-Hai Amin a-Nadim
Notes: Killed while fleeing from his house along with other members of the family. Two sons of his were lightly injured.

Name: 'Issa Muhammad Jaber Abu 'Aydah
Notes: Killed while standing next to his house and a wagon passing by him was bombed.

Name: Ihssan Mahmoud Zaki al-Hadad
Notes: Burned to death with her husband and two children when the car in which they were fleeing from their home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood was bombed with phosphorous.

Name: Hatem 'Udai Salamah al-Hadad
Notes: Burned to death with his parents and sister when the car they in which they were fleeing from their home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood was bombed with phosphorous.

Name: 'Udai Salamah Yusef al-Hadad
Notes: Burned to death with his wife and two children when the car in which they were fleeing from their home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood was bombed with phosphorous.

Name: Alaa 'Udai Salamah al-Hadad
Notes: Burned to death with her parents and brother when the car they were in while trying to flee from their home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood was bombed with phosphorous.

Name: Haitham 'Abd al-Hafez Yusef 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed in a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Salem a-Na'uq
Notes: Killed while sitting with his family and neighbors in a yard of a house on al-'Awadeh Street.

Name: 'Abd a-Latif Muhammad Muhammad a-Na'uq
Notes: Killed while sitting with his family and neighbors in a yard of a house on al-'Awadeh Street.

Name: Fadi Taysir Mustafa 'Abdallah
Notes: Killed while sitting with his family and neighbors in a yard of a house on al-'Awadeh Street.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Mahmoud 'Abdallah
Notes: Killed while sitting with his family and neighbors in a yard of a house on al-'Awadeh Street.

Name: Rajab Mahmoud Ahmad 'Alwan
Notes: Killed while sitting with his family and neighbors in a yard of a house on al-'Awadeh Street.

Name: Muhammad Majed 'Ali Hussein
Notes: Killed while he was at home.

Name: Thaer Soheil 'Ali Hussein
Notes: Killed while he was at home.

Name: Muhammad Faraj Sa'id Dughmosh
Notes: Killed with Hamdan Daghmash in a-Sabrah neighborhood.

Name: Hamdan Jalal Jamil Dughmosh
Notes: Killed with Muhammad Daghmash in a-Sabrah neighborhood.

Name: 'Abd a-Naser Jamal As'ad Shuheibar
Notes: Killed while trying to rescue his cousin.

Name: Ahmad Muzayan Musa Sha'ban
Notes: Killed with his brother while fleeing from his home, near the house of senior Hamas official Mahmud a-Zahar, which was being bombed. Another brother was wounded in the incident and died 15 days later.

Name: Muhammad Muzayan Musa Sha'ban
Notes: Wounded while fleeing from his home, near the house of senior Hamas official Mahmud a-Zahar, which was being bombed, and died some two weeks later from his wounds. Two of his brothers were killed in the incident.

Name: Bilal Muzayan Musa Sha'ban
Notes: Killed with his brother while fleeing from his home, near the house of senior Hamas official Mahmud a-Zahar, which was being bombed. Another brother was wounded in the incident and died 15 days later.

Name: Maher Hashem Hamdan Dughmosh
Notes: He heard a bomb strike his neighbor's house and went with his son to see what happened. He was killed and his son was wounded when another missile was fired at [??struck??] the house.

Name: Hanin Fadel Muhammad al-Batran
Notes: Killed while fleeing with her family from their house in a-Tufah neighborhood.

Name: Ahmad Ayub 'Issam al-Bitar
Notes: Killed in a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Miqbal 'Eid Salam Jarabi'
Notes: Killed when he exited his house in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo. The house was destroyed.

Name: Ahmad 'Ata Musa al-Ktnani
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'f neighborhood together with four other civilians, as they tried to help two wounded armed persons, who were also killed.

Name: Ahmad Faiz Sha'ban al-Bahtiti
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'f neighborhood together with his father and three other civilians, as they tried to help two wounded armed persons, who were also killed.

Name: Saaeb Nafez Sha'ban al-Bahtiti
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'f neighborhood together with four other civilians, as they tried to help two wounded armed persons, who were also killed.

Name: Faiz Sha'ban 'Omar al-Bahtiti
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'f neighborhood together with his son and three other civilians, as they tried to help two wounded armed persons, who were also killed.

Name: Soheil Yunes Ibrahim a-Safdi
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'f neighborhood together with four other civilians, as they tried to help two wounded armed persons, who were also killed.

Name: Jamal 'Ata Muhammad al-Habshi
Notes: An operative in the military wing of Hamas, he fled from his house when it was bombed. He was hit by a missile in the street, in a-Sha'af neighborhood. Five civilians who went to help him and Ayman 'Amarah were also killed.

Name: Ayman Muhammad Darwish 'Amarah
Notes: Killed in a-Sh'af neighborhood as he was fleeing with Jamal al-Habashi. Five civilians who came to help them were also killed.

Name: Ramadan Sha'ban al-Barawi al-Faluji
Notes: Killed in a-Sha'af neighborhood.

Name: Ousamah Jamal Muhammad A'beid
Notes: Killed in a-Siftawi neighborhood.

Name: 'Ammar Muhammad Ahmad Hasunah
Notes: Killed in a-Sudaniyah neighborhood.

Name: 'Abdallah 'Abd al-Hamid Abu Mu'ammar
Notes: Killed in a-Nasser neighborhood.

Name: Ahmad 'Abd al-Hai Hassan a-Safdi
Notes: Killed while firing, with other armed men, rockets at Israel.

Name: Zuheir 'Abd al-Hamid Ramadan al-'Alul
Notes: Killed while in the street in a-Sabra neighborhood with armed persons from his family.

Name: Ahmad Zuheir 'Abd al-Hamid al-'Alul
Notes: Killed when moving about with other armed men in a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Ramadan 'Abd al-Hamid Ramadan al-'Alul
Notes: Killed when moving about with other armed men in a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Mahmoud Zuheir 'Abd al-Hamid al-'Alul

Name: 'Ali Salamah Diab al-Khatib
Notes: Killed while walking in the street.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Khamis Abu Qamer
Notes: Killed while walking on the street.

Name: Muhammad Amin Mustafa Heji
Notes: Killed when at home in a-Zeitun neighborhood by a shell that struck the house.

Name: 'Ula Ma'sud Khalil 'Arafat
Notes: Killed by soldiers' firing in a-Zaitun neighborhood along with Shahd Haji and Muhammad Samir Haji, as they tried to get to a safe place together with other civilians.

Name: Muhammad Samir Amin Heji
Notes: Killed along with Shahd Haji and 'Ula 'Arafat from soldiers' fire while they were trying to reach a safe place with other persons. His name was mentioned on the Islamic Jihad website.

Name: Shahd Muhammad Amin Heji
Notes: Daughter of Muhammad Amin Haji, who had previously been killed by a shell that struck the family's house. Killed with Muhammad Samir Haji and 'Ola 'Arafat by soldiers' gunfire as they tried along with other persons to reach a safe place, after soldiers ordered them to leave their house. Her mother was wounded.

Name: Ibrahim Mu'in al-'Abed Juha
Notes: Killed when he left his house with his family upon soldiers' orders. The family was carrying a white flag. He was shot by soldiers who were inside a house. He lay dying for hours as the army did not allow an ambulance to enter the area.

Name: Ayman Ahmad 'Amer al-Kurd
Notes: Killed in al-'Atatreh neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Samir 'Abd a-Latif Salem

Name: Muhammad Nahed Muhammad 'Abd Rabo

Name: Yunes Muhammad 'Abd al-Wahab al-Ghandur

Name: Naji Nidal 'Abd a-Salam al-Hamlawi

Name: Ousamah Jihad 'Ali Abu Jbarah

Name: Basel Jihad 'Ali Abu Jbarah

Name: Jihad 'Ali Ahmad Abu Jbarah

Name: Ahmad Sidqi Hamdan Kahil
Notes: Killed with two members of his family when their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Fadwa Khalil Muhammad Kahil
Notes: Killed with two members of her family when their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Mahmoud Sidqi Hamdan Kahil
Notes: Killed with two members of his family when their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Ahmad Hassan 'Abd al-Karim Abu Zor
Notes: Killed by a missile while trying to close a water pipe next to his house.

Name: 'Alaa Ibrahim Salamah Matar

Name: Ahmad Fathi Muhammad Matar
Notes: Killed next to his house with his cousin 'Alaa Matar.

Name: Zakaria 'Abd a-Naser Ibrahim a-Kiyali

Name: Ahmad Fathi Mustafa a-Nazli
Notes: Killed next to a mosque.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Nabih al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed next to a mosque.

Name: Zakaria Hamed Khamis a-Samuni

Name: Muti'ah 'Abd a-Rahman Ibrahim a-Samuni
Notes: Killed at the entrance to her house.

Name: Razaqeh Wael Fares a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Iyad 'Izzat 'Ali a-Samuni
Notes: Shot in the leg by soldiers while walking at the head of a group from the Samuni family who were trying to leave the area, his hands bound and waving a white flag. The soldiers refused to let the family evacuate him.

Name: Layla Nabih Mahmoud a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Ahmad 'Atiyyah Helmi a-Samuni
Notes: Shot by soldiers who came into the house and opened fire, killing his father, 'Attiyah a-Samuni, and wounding him and others in the family. Soldiers did not let ambulances enter the area, and he died.

Name: 'Atiyyah Helmi Mahmoud a-Samuni
Notes: Shot and killed by soldiers who came into the house and opened fire. His four-year-old son later died from his wounds, after soldiers did not let an ambulance enter the area. Other family members were wounded.

Name: Nassar Ibrahim Helmi a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Ibtesam Ahmad Muhammad al-Qanu'
Notes: Soldiers demolished her house with a bulldozer and shot and killed her when she exited the house with her mother-in-law, waving a white flag.

Name: Ibrahim Kamal Subhi 'Awajeh
Notes: Killed while on the street in a-Salatin neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad 'Abed Hassan Barbakh
Notes: Killed with his father, two brothers, and cousin while cutting wood for a baking oven in the yard of the house.

Name: Mahdi 'Abed Hassan Barbakh
Notes: Killed together with his father, two of his brothers, and his cousin when they were cutting wood for the baking oven in the yard of the house.

Name: Yusef 'Abed Muhsen Barbakh
Notes: Killed together with his father, two of his brothers, and his cousin while they were cutting wood for the baking oven in the yard of the house.

Name: Musa Yusef Hassan Barbakh
Notes: Killed together with his uncle and cousins while they were cutting wood for the baking oven in the yard of the house.

Name: 'Abed Hassan Muhammad Barbakh
Notes: Killed with three of his sons and his nephew while they were cutting wood for the baking oven in the yard of the house.

Name: 'Ali Musa Samir al-Qatnani
Notes: He was wounded as he fled from his house with members of his family and was killed when the ambulance that arrived to evacuate him was attacked.

Name: 'Arafah Hani 'Arafat 'Abd a-Dayem
Notes: A paramedic, he was killed while treating wounded persons.

Name: Jihad Kamal Hassan Ahmad
Notes: Killed while riding in a car with her family.

Name: Rida Khalil Hassan 'Ali
Notes: Killed while riding in a taxi with members of her family.

Name: Rawhi Jamal Ramadan a-Sultan
Notes: Killed in the yard of the UNRWA Asma'a school, where his family had found refuge.

Name: Hussein Mahmoud 'Abd al-Malek a-Sultan
Notes: Killed in the yard of the UNRWA Asma'a school, where his family had found refuge.

Name: 'Abed Samir 'Ali a-Sultan
Notes: Killed in the yard of the UNRWA Asma'a school, where his family had found refuge.

Name: a-Sayed Jawwad Muhammad a-Siksik
Notes: Killed while on the roof of his house.

Name: 'Eid 'Aiyadah Salem Abu Rabi'
Notes: Killed next to his house.

Name: Khalil Muhammad Ibrahim Miqdad
Notes: A fisherman, he was killed by a missile fired towards the coast that struck his nearby house. Ten minutes earlier, a missile had been fired at Ashkelon from that area.

Name: 'Abdallah Haydar Khalil Abu 'Odeh
Notes: A student, he was killed by a missile fired towards the coast that struck his nearby house. Ten minutes earlier, a missile had been fired at Ashkelon from that area.

Name: Hamzah Zuheir Rizeq Tantish
Notes: Killed with his cousin while they were on the roof of the house.

Name: Mahmoud Zaher Rizeq Tantish
Notes: Killed with his cousin while they were on the roof of the house.

Name: Shatha al-'Abed Muhammad al-Habash
Notes: Killed with her cousin while they were playing on the roof of the house. Three other children were wounded.

Name: Israa Qusai Muhammad al-Habash
Notes: Killed with her cousin while they were playing on the roof of the house. Three other children were wounded.

Name: Ruba Muhammad Fadel Abu Ras
Notes: Killed while next to her house in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Bilal 'Abd Rabo Muhammad Shihab
Notes: Killed along with two other combatants.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Hadi Muhammad Daher
Notes: Killed along with two other combatants.

Name: Muhammad Muti'a Muhammad a-Sharafi
Notes: Killed while with two other combatants.

Name: Jihad Samir Faiz Erhim
Notes: Killed near his home in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Anas 'Aref 'Aref Barakah
Notes: Killed on farmland next to his house. He was taken to Egypt for treatment and died there.

Name: Mahmoud Khaled 'Alian al-Masharawi
Notes: Killed with his cousin while playing on the roof of the house.

Name: Ahmad Khader Diab Sbieh
Notes: Killed with his cousin while playing on the roof of the house.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Hamid As'ad Abu Kmeil
Notes: Killed when he was about to fire rockets at Israel.

Name: Ahmad Hussein 'Abd Rabo al-Mabhuh
Notes: Killed next to his house, near a group of armed persons operating in the area.

Name: Muhammad Mu'in 'Atiyyah Abu al-Jidyan
Notes: Killed while on the street with friends.

Name: Muhammad Naser 'Atiyyah Hamdunah
Notes: Killed while in the street with friends.

Name: Hisham Hamdan al-'Abed al-Fayumi
Notes: Killed when struck by a missile while fleeing with his family from his house in the bombed a-Sh'af neighborhood. Members of his family were wounded.

Name: Fouad Mahmoud Hassan al-Hilu
Notes: Killed by the gunfire of soldiers who had entered his house.

Name: Farah 'Ammar Fouad al-Hilu
Notes: Killed while she fled from her house with her family after her grandfather was shot by soldiers who entered the house.

Name: Walid Rashad Helmi a-Samuni
Notes: His name appears on the Islamic Jihad list, but B'Tselem's investigation indicates he was not active in the military wing.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Helmi a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. Name: 'Issa Ahmad Muhammad al-'Attut
Notes: Killed in Jabal al-Kashef neighborhood, in the eastern section of Jabalya.

Name: Iyad Nabil 'Abd a-Rahman Saleh
Notes: Killed while he was next to his house in al-'Awadeh Towers.

Name: Wadi' Amin 'Omar 'Omar
Notes: Killed while at home with members of his family.

Name: Salman Hammad Maraziq Abu Khamash
Notes: Killed while on his way to buy flour.

Name: Mahmoud Sami Yihya 'Asaliyah
Notes: Killed while at home with members of his family.

Name: 'Omar Sa'dallah 'Abd al-Jawad al-Jaru
Notes: Killed at home with his family.

Name: 'Aead 'Imad Jamal Khaireh
Notes: Killed while walking in an area in which armed persons were present.

Name: Wael Yusef Matar Abu Jarad
Notes: Killed when he went up to the second floor of his house in a-Zeitun neighborhood to get water for his family. His name was mentioned on the Fatah website as a combatant, but B'Tselem's investigation found no evidence to support the claim.

Name: 'Abed a-Sayyed Yusef Khamis 'Omar
Notes: Killed in a-Salatin neighborhood where there was an exchange of fire between Palestinian operatives and soldiers.

Name: 'Abd al-'Aziz Muhammad Mustafa a-Najar
Notes: Killed in a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Suliman Khalil al-Jamasi
Notes: Killed along with 'Atta Bahar in a-Sha'af neighborhood after they fired rockets.

Name: 'Ata Samir 'Ata Bhar
Notes: Killed along with Muhammad al-Jamasi in a-Sha'af neighborhood after they fired rockets.

Name: Sa'id Ahmad Rashad al-'Asali
Notes: Killed in a-Twam neighborhood.

Name: Muhammad Fouad Mahmoud al-Helu
Notes: An armed operative, he was killed while moving about in a-Zeitun neighborhood with other armed men.

Name: Hassan 'Issam Hassan al-Jamasi
Notes: Killed while moving about in a-Zeitun neighborhood with other armed men.

Name: Muhammad Bassam Muhammad 'Anan
Notes: Killed while moving about in a-Zeitun neighborhood with other armed men.

Name: Mustafa Zuhdi Mustafa Erhim
Notes: An armed operative, he was killed while moving about in a-Zeitun neighborhood with other armed men.

Name: 'Atiyyah Rushdi Khalil al-Khuli
Notes: Killed when moving about in a-Zeitun neighborhood with other armed persons.

Name: 'Omar Ahmad Mahmoud al-Bard'i
Notes: Killed while transporting paramedics to wounded combatants.

Name: Yasser Kamal Shbeir
Notes: A paramedic, he was killed while treating combatants who had been wounded.

Name: Anas Fadel Na'im
Notes: A paramedic, he was killed while treating combatants who had been wounded.

Name: Raafat Sami Ibrahim Muharam
Notes: A hospital volunteer, he was killed while treating combatants who had been wounded.

Name: Ghazi 'Awni 'Abd al-Fatah Jadu'
Notes: Killed with his two brothers when their house in a-Sabra neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Hashem 'Awni 'Abd al-Fatah Jadu'
Notes: Killed with his two brothers when their house in a-Sabra neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Lutfi 'Awni 'Abd al-Fatah Jadu'
Notes: Killed with his two brothers when their house in a-Sabra neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Muhammad Faraj Isma'il Hasunah
Notes: Killed in a-Tufah neighborhood while on his way to his sister's house.

Name: Bahaa a-Din        Kamal Abu Wadi
Notes: Killed while he was with his family at home in a-Zaitun neighborhood.

Name: Safeyeh Salem Hussein Haydar
Notes: Killed while next to her house.

Name: Shawqi 'Abd al-Jawad Mitqal al-'Attar
Notes: Killed at the entrance to his house while waiting for his mother, who had gone onto the roof to wave a white flag.

Name: Wiam Jamal Mahmoud al-Kafarneh
Notes: Killed while she was at home with members of her family, all of whom were wounded in the shelling.

Name: Jamileh 'Abd al-'Aziz Salem a-Da'ur
Notes: Her body and the body of her son were found bullet-ridden in their home.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad a-Da'ur
Notes: His body and the body of his mother were found bullet-ridden in their home.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Ahmad 'Abd Rabo al-'Atawneh
Notes: Killed Was on his way home. His body was found in the street.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Razeq al-Hileh
Notes: Killed while with other armed men in al-Amal neighborhood.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahim Helmi al-'Abed al-Ashqar
Notes: Killed while sitting in his living room.

Name: Ahmad Yusef Ibrahim al-Batsh
Notes: His body was found after the army withdrew.

Name: Bassam 'Azmi Muhammad al-Hatab
Notes: His body was found after the army withdrew.

Name: Isma'il 'Abdallah Suliman Abu Sneimah
Notes: Killed while on his way home from visiting his sister in a-Shuhadaa Village, near the Kerem Shalom crossing.

Name: Ziad Muhammad Salma Abu Sneimah
Notes: Killed while playing in the street next to his house.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Mahmoud Adham
Notes: Killed at the entrance to his house by gunfire of a soldier who was on the roof of Abu 'Omar al-Khatab School.

Name: Samir 'Aiyadah Yusef a-Sharafi
Notes: Killed while standing at the entrance to his house.

Name: Ahmad Sami Ahmad Abu Madyan
Notes: Killed while on his way home with his wife and two of his children. Two members of the family were wounded.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Ahmad al-Bal'awi
Notes: Killed in a bombing while he was next to a children's hospital.

Name: Na'im Hussein Mustafa A'bbas
Notes: An activist in the militant wing of Hamas, he was killed while sitting in a yard with friends.

Name: Hamuda Shihadah Khader Abu Sultan
Notes: Killed while sitting with friends in the yard of a house.

Name: Nuh Hamuda Shihadah Abu Sultan
Notes: Killed while sitting with friends in the yard.

Name: a-Sayed Hamuda Shihadah Abu Sultan
Notes: Killed while sitting with friends in the yard.

Name: Isma'il Musa Isma'il a-Susi
Notes: Killed while sitting in the yard of a house with friends.

Name: Ibrahim Ziad Ramadan a-Nimer
Notes: Killed while standing on the roof of his house with members of his family.

Name: 'Abd al-Karim Ziad Ramadan a-Nimer
Notes: Killed while standing on the roof of his house with members of his family.

Name: Suhair Ziad Ramadan a-Nimer
Notes: Killed while standing on the roof of her house with members of her family.

Name: Asmaa Ibrahim Hussein 'Afanah
Notes: Killed while standing on the roof of a house with members of her family.

Name: Ayman Muhammad Muhammad 'Afanah
Notes: A policeman, he was killed while standing on the roof of a house with his family in a-Zeitun neighborhood. His name is mentioned on the website of the military wing of Hamas, but as far as B'Tselem knows, he did not take part in the hostilities.

Name: Qusai Riyad Muhammad al-Batrikhi
Notes: Killed after he and other armed persons fired rockets at Israel.

Name: Sami Khalil Sa'id Lazan
Notes: Killed at his home in a-Sudaniya neighborhood. His wife was injured in the incident.

Name: 'Aead 'Abd al-Hadi 'Abd al-Khaleq Abu Nada
Notes: Killed while riding a moped home from work.

Name: Sa'dallah Matar Ma'sud Abu Halimah
Notes: Was directly hit and killed by a white phosphorous shell that entered his house. Four of his children were burned to death in the incident and his daughter-in-law was severely burned and later died from her wounds. Four other family members suffered burns.

Name: Luai Yihya Salman Abu Halimah
Notes: Killed while playing with friends outside his house. His friends were wounded.

Name: Ghadah Riyad Rajab Abu Halimah
Notes: Was severely burned when a white phosphorous shell struck her house, and died later from her wounds. Four others from her family were burned to death in the incident and her father-in-law was killed when struck directly by the shell. Four other family members, including her infant daughter, suffered burns.

Name: Matar Sa'ed Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Shot by soldiers while he and his family were waving a white flag and driving on a tractor-drawn wagon to the hospital, after their house had been shelled with white phosphorous.

Name: Muhammad Hikmat Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Shot by soldiers while he and his family were waving a white flag and driving on a tractor-drawn wagon to the hospital, after their house had been shelled with white phosphorous.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahim Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Burned to death together with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck their house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five others in the family were burned, one of whom later died from her wounds.

Name: Shahd Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Burned to death along with three of her brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck her house. Her father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

Name: Zeid Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Burned to death along with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck his house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

Name: Hamzah Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
Notes: Burned to death along with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck his house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

Name: Ahmad Khalil Saleh Abu Daf
Notes: Killed while standing outside his house.

Name: 'Awni Sa'di Salman a-Dib
Notes: Killed while standing at the entrance to his house by gunfire aimed at his neighbor, Ahmad Abu Daf, an operative in the military wing of Hamas.

Name: Bassam Muhammad Faruk Abu 'Ajwah
Notes: Killed on his way to shopping by a missile aimed at a vehicle that missed the target.

Name: Ghassan 'Ali 'Ali Abu al-'Imrin
Notes: Killed by shrapnel that struck him in the head.

Name: Majedah 'Abd al-Karim Abu Hajaj
Notes: Killed with her mother by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

Name: Rayah Salamah Salman Abu Hajaj
Notes: Killed with her daughter by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

Name: Mu'in 'Ata Hussein
Notes: Not a member of a militant organization, he was killed while providing assistance to armed men in the course of hostilities.

Name: Mamduh 'Amar Musa al-Jamal
Notes: Killed while leaving a mosque in Tel al-Hawa neighborhood.

Name: Salah Na'im Ahmad Sheldan
Notes: An activist in the militant wing of Hamas.

Name: Sharif 'Abd al-Mu'ti Suliman Irmeilat
Notes: Killed while sitting in a tent near his house. Ten of his relatives were wounded.

Name: Muhammad Musa Hassan al-'Ur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of his family.

Name: Iman Nimer Suliman al-'Arur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of her family.

Name: Rakan Muhammad Musa al-'Ur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of his family.

Name: Ibrahim Muhammad Musa al-'Ur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of his family.

Name: Fidaa Muhammad Musa al-'Ur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of her family.

Name: Shahd Hussein Nazmi Sultan
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Ahmad Hamed Hassan Abu 'Aytah
Notes: A policeman, he was killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. Fifteen persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from Islamic Jihad.

Name: Yusef Ziad Ahmad Zaqut
Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. Fifteen persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from Islamic Jihad.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad Qteifan al-Masamhah
Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five operatives from the Hamas military wing and one operative from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one member of the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. Fifteen persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from Islamic Jihad.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. Fifteen persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from Islamic Jihad.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Name: Hani Muhammad Musa a-Silawi
Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Name: Muhammad Musa Isma'il a-Silawi
Notes: Killed by mortar fire that hit the street next to UNRWA's al-Fakhura school, in the Jabalya refugee camp, where persons had gone for refuge having been forced to leave their houses. Earlier, militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: 'Omar 'Abd al-Hafez Musa a-Silawi
Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. Fifteen persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from Islamic Jihad.

Name: Ahmad Isma'il Musa a-Silawi
Notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

Name: Ahmad Shaher Fa'iq Khdeir
Notes: Killed while next to his house.

Name: Shadi 'Ayesh Hussein a-Shurbaji
Notes: Killed in a-Sikah neighborhood along with Mahmud Abu Ma'ruf while riding in a car.

Name: Mahmoud 'Adnan Mahmoud Abu Ma'ruf
Notes: Killed in a-Sikah neighborhood along with Shadi a-Shurbaji while riding in a car.

Name: Amjad Majed Subhi al-'Attar
Notes: Killed while moving about with other armed men in area of al-'Atatreh.

Name: Wael Khalil Mesbah al-'Attar
Notes: Killed while moving about with other armed men in area of al-'Atatreh.

Name: Mahmoud Salah Ahmad al-Ghul
Notes: A student, he was killed on his family's farm.

Name: Akram Fares Jaber al-Ghul
Notes: A judge who had resigned after Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip, he was killed on his family's farm.

Name: Ahmad Fawzi Hassan Lubad
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Yusef 'Othman Mustafa Abu Hasanein
Notes: Killed while on his way to his brother's house, close to the border.

Name: Muhammad Maher Sayah Abu Sweireh

Name: Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Muhammad Rayan
Notes: Senior Hamas official. Killed with his four wives and 11 children. The army contends his house was used to store ammunition and that a tunnel had been built under it. Army officials state that the family had been warned about the impending attack, but they refused to leave the house.

Name: Nawal Isma'il Rayan
Notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. According to officials, the army warned the family but they refused to leave the house.

Name: Nafez Kamal 'Abd al-Jawad Abu Sabt
Notes: Killed with Muhammad Abu Daqa after he helped his cousin remove the contents of the house , which had been bombed by the army. He went on a wagon that had items from the house, including gas canisters. B'Tselem checked reports contending they were transporting weapons, but rejected the claims.

Name: Muhammad Isma'il 'Abed Abu Daqah
Notes: Killed with Nafez Abu Sabt after helping his neighbors remove the contents of their house that had been bombed by the army. Was riding in a wagon on which the contents, including gas canisters, had been loaded. B'Tselem checked reports contending that they had been transporting weapons, but found no support for the claim.

Name: Thaer Jihad Ahmad a-Najar

Name: Shehdeh Hamdan Hussein Abu Teilakh
